weaponDesc.cn:
我不是第一次听他们提到“文明的食腐动物”这个话题，只是我还没有亲眼见过。
很多人难以理解，塔卫二的生活充满了困难。城市与社区之间需要团结一致才能渡过难关，但仍然有不少人选择离开城市，过着流浪者和投机者的生活。
但是我并不会感到奇怪，有些人失去得太多了。就像我上周采访的那十几位难民，他们的社区遭遇了灾害，食物严重短缺，根本没有选择。
但也有一部分人，他们单纯地不愿意遵守某种秩序，或是天生坏种，他们自愿生活在暴力和危险之中。
但归根究底，他们无法摆脱“文明”本身。我上周看到这些人正在使用捡来的机械工具制造武器，我真的很好奇，他们是从哪里弄到一台完整的车床的。然而，最终的答案其实很简单，他们会从城市的垃圾堆中碰碰运气，找到他们所需的一切。
“文明的食腐动物”这个说法非常贴切，对吧？
顺便提一下，报社的那个小记者，下次不要让她跟着我。她这一辈子就应该待在围墙后面，生活在城市里。一个连睡袋都难以接受的人，不应该在开拓区乱跑。老老实实去当个明星跟班更适合她。
weaponDesc.en:
Though this wasn't the first time they talked about Bander Scavs, I never really saw one myself.
People can't really appreciate how difficult life could be out there on Talos-II. Band cities and neighborhoods must work closely together to survive, yet many Banders chose to leave the city behind to live as a nomad or prospector in the frontiers.
I myself wasn't too surprised by this. These people had lost too much. I interviewed around a dozen refugees last week from a disaster-stricken neighborhood that ran out of food. They had no other choice.
However, there were also some who refused to live in a world of law or were simply sociopaths. These individuals preferred a life filled with constant violence and danger.
Regardless of their intents, no Bander nomads could truly give up the touch of civilization. Also last week, I saw them craft weapons with a scavenged machine tool. I was extremely curious how they managed to get their hands on a working lathe. The answer was simple. They got lucky with a scavenging run through a Bander city dumpsite. These landfills provided for their every need.
Turned out that Bander Scav was a pretty accurate name for these people.
If you're reading this, tell that little Bander journalist to stop stalking me. People who complain about sleeping bags do not belong in the wildlands. She should get back to her cushy Bander place and stick to being a celebrity tabloid writer.

weaponDesc.cn:
我没法认同亨利的想法。
雷神工业的产品一直沉浸在那套实用主义说辞当中，这显然只是自我逃避。形式是传统的积累，是经验的总和，自然赋予了人们趋利避害的直观感触，典雅与融洽本身就是茫茫历史对何为完美的无声回答。
就算是为了向他们证明这一点，我也一定要拿下这次竞标。

我有九种办法达到目标破坏效果，但哪种都不应该出现在这个尺寸的武器上。
听说亨利打算试试爆燃脉冲，可笑。那得是一把剑，客户可没答应咱们给大炮安个握柄。

参数不合格。
亨利找我聊了一会儿，他们似乎也束手无策。不知道客户看见两家竞标企业的设计师凑在一块聊天会是什么感想。

指标定得太高了，老板怎么会同意这种要求？
就算那位老兄直接提着样品去了总部，只想要个一模一样的，那也是怪家伙们挖出来的怪东西。该想的不应该是丢不丢脸，而是会不会丢命吧？

洗澡的时候灵光乍现，顺利满足了最低要求。唱歌果然有用。
一口气劈断四层装甲车的核心装甲板，我不相信雷神工业能给出比这更好的方案。物理学是有极限的，不管我们之间存在多少异见，至少都应该认识到这一点。

寂语修会顺利重启了那件样品。
十六层。等抢修完天花板，他们似乎打算试试三十二层。
沿对角线斜着劈。
我还是找领导再商量商量吧。
weaponDesc.en:
I refused to agree with Henry's ideas.
The RAYTHEAN motto of making practical products is mere escapism. The form of a weapon is a conclusive result of both traditions and experience. Nature has granted us intuitive senses to differentiate between things that work and things that don't. Elegance and harmony are the unspoken answers for perfection that we arrived at thanks to the countless years of our history and hard-earned experiences.
And I must seize this bid just to prove this point.

I got 9 ways to achieve the level of destruction desired by the client, but none of them should be used by a weapon of this size.
I also heard that Henry decided to test out his flash-burn impulse technology. Laughable. The client specifically requested a sword, not a cannon with a hilt welded to it.

Weapon performance failed to meet the desired specifications.
Henry had a short discussion with me. His team was also out of ideas. I didn't know what the client might think if they saw this private meeting of weapon designers from 2 competing companies. 

Their specifications were impossible. Why did the boss agree to take on this contract?
Even if the dude took the sample prototype to HQ and wanted something with the exact same performance, he would just get another strange artifact unearthed by another bunch of weirdos. We now have more than reputation to worry about. These untested and strange devices pose a threat to our very lives.

I received a flash of inspiration during shower that might just help us meet the minimum specs. I knew bathroom opera would work.
A stack of 4 core armor slabs of armored vehicles? Hmph. My solution could go through that in a single slash. I doubt if RAYTHEAN has a better alternative. Physics is a hard science with hard limits. We may have our differences, but both of us should acknowledge this truth.

The Cabal of Tranquility re-activated the prototype.
It went through ... a stack of 16 armor slabs. The Cabal intends to run another test with a stack of 32 once emergency repairs for the ceiling is complete.
They even proposed a diagonal cut from corner to corner.
Maybe I should talk to the boss about this.

weaponDesc.cn:
亲爱的克拉马斯·鲍勃：
我已经收到了你发给我的信息。原本我想和你当面聊聊，但还有十个小时车队就要出发前往北方前线。经过反复思考，我还是决定给你回信，因为车队出发后，我将很难通过通信设备与你联系。
我理解你的顾虑，也知道你们团队此时感到难过和沮丧。但请相信我，作为你的导师，我的判断并不是基于个人情感，而是出于对整体情况的分析。单凭我个人的意见也无法影响市场部门的决策。你们提交的技术图纸之所以能够获得认可，是因为产品设计确实非常出色，你可以对此更自信一点。
两个月前，革新技术部门的工程师公布了源石离心轮发动机的小型化成品，这让我感到惊讶。这种新型号的源石发动机实现了底层技术的一次迭代与革新，突破了过去许多源石发动机中能量转换的理论上限。要知道，一年前我还认为他们的原型机没有小型化的可能性，认为他们的理论只能永远停留在图纸上。然而，事实证明我陷入了思维的舒适圈，未能预见到技术的进步。
但你们不必因此对自己的学术能力失去信心。你们还年轻，依然有许多选择。对传统源石发动机技术的深入研究仍然具有重要意义。然而，正如我之前所说，技术总是会不断迭代。有时，承认自己多年来的努力正在失去意义是一件困难的事情。但作为技术人员，不要让情感影响你们对客观现实的判断。
当然，根据我过去的经验，全新的技术在彻底普及之前，通常会经历一个漫长的应用期。在泰拉时代被广泛使用的老产品，尽管噪音较大、源石能源转化效率不高，但它们具有新型号产品所不具备的优点：结构可靠，维护简单方便。因此，旧设计仍会继续被使用，直到被完全替换的那一天。
尽管如此，你们的产品设计依然非常出色，你也是一位优秀的工程师。我相信你和你的团队在未来会找到新的发展方向。
我非常期待下次见面时看到你们的新进展。

你的朋友和导师
威纶·辛克莱
weaponDesc.en:
Dear Klamath Bob:
I received your message. Though I desire to have this discussion in person, my convoy must depart for the Northern Front in 10 hours. It was with some hesitation that I decided to pen this reply. Do be aware that I will have difficulty contacting you via conventional comm devices once the convoy sets off.
I understand your concerns and I'm very well aware of the sadness and disappointment experienced by your team. As your mentor, you must understand that my decision was nothing personal and must cater to the bigger picture. My opinions alone would not sway the strategies of our marketing department. The fact that your technical blueprints earned no small amount of approval is a testament to the outstanding performance of your designs. You should be confident about that.
Just two months ago, I was shocked when engineers from the fringe tech department released a working example of a miniaturized centrifugal Originium generator. It shattered the theoretical limits of energy conversion ratios for such devices and would certainly usher in the next revolutionary change for the very foundations of power generation. Even I would have brushed it off as mere hypothetical fantasy just 12 months ago but the truth proved otherwise. I was trapped in a comfort zone that blinded me from the scientific advancements that was within our reach.
So, don't let this setback dishearten you or keep you from learning. You are young and your choices are many. Though conventional Originium power generation remains a field with great potential, science and technology are always changing. It is difficult to accept failure, especially after so many years of hard work. But remember that you are an engineer. Do not let emotions affect your objectivity.
Based on my own experiences, there will be a protracted period of time before the new tech becomes fully adopted. Stories from the Age of Terra often describe noisy old engines with abysmal Originium energy conversion ratios. Despite their poor performance, these engines offered advantages that the latest generators could not hope to provide — reliability and ease of maintenance. The world still has a place for the legacy workhorses and it will be long until they are completely phased out.
Regardless of what I've said, your product design remains an outstanding work of engineering. I have faith that you and your team will quickly find a new direction.
I look forward to hearing more about your progress in the future.

Your friend and mentor,
Willem Sinclair

weaponDesc.cn:
她比其他人看得更清楚一些。
跨过那扇门的旅途比她想象的要局促一些。一些幻影，一些迷离的色彩，肌肤上一闪而过的不切实际的触感，还有短暂的眩晕、低语、关于过往的碎片，紧接着，是严寒。从冬天回到冬天的严寒，很有真实感。
她立刻询问身边的每一个人，每一个人都告诉了她不同的答案。有些人觉得眼睛一闭一睁就没事了，有些人则气喘吁吁地表示自己仿佛静滞了好几天的时间。
她很好奇自己所见的东西是否有什么意义——好奇是她的天性。她花了几个小时在脑海里锚定那些色块、线条和不规律的音色。但它们就像春天小憩时的梦境那样难以捉摸，缺乏含义。
直到她在一片旖旎的光线中看向了没有阻隔层的星空。
塔罗斯。

时间并没有把夕阳带到塔卫二的极点，巨大的星球占据了所有人的视野，像是某种远超巫王的巫术那样死死掐住了她的灵魂。她无法移开目光，她从未想过知识和财富之外，自然的景色会如此吸引她——如果宇宙这个崭新的视角能归类为自然的话，她不是很确定。
她端详着塔罗斯。这是一颗几乎静止的大星球，戴上了可爱的环形丝带。她只在婶婶的缝纫机上见过这样可爱的丝带，像是花瓣的边缘。很快，她就发现静止只是塔罗斯可爱的小伎俩，这颗星球似乎正在不起眼地运动着。表面的光泽在流动，她能听见风声。
但很快，这一切都消失了。塔罗斯又变回了那个一动不动的巨物。她感到心跳加速，一些不规律的想法涌现在脑海里。从儿时第一份法术课答卷开始，一直到去年在高塔上完成的进取研究。她看到了父母的面孔，看到了老师，看到了残垣断壁里伸出的一只手，看到了深远的流沙。她在漆黑的海岸边站稳脚跟，最后是自己的面庞，儿时所见的莱塔尼亚的天空，数星星的玩伴变成了无数个自己。
她生平第一次有了这样的冲动。她狂热地爱上塔罗斯，狂热地想要触碰那颗巨大的星星。
她感到那颗巨大的星星将一切联系了起来。
依照这种联系，流淌在她体内的源石开始轻声合唱。
从那一天起，她不再变化，她必须成为一位长生者，一如她痴爱的星球。
weaponDesc.en:
She saw it more clearly than anyone else.
Stepping through the gate was a journey that was a tad quicker than she had imagined. Her eyes saw illusions and indescribable colors while her skin felt unreal sensations brushing against it. There were flashes of dizziness, bursts of murmurings, and fragments from the past. These were quickly followed by a bitter cold of winter trailing into something even more frigid. Everything felt so real to her.
She immediately asked everyone around and they gave her different answers. Some said it was over in a blink of an eye. Others panted with exhaustion and claimed that they were trapped in a stasis for days.
She was curious about the things she saw, for curiosity was part of her nature. She spent hours memorizing the patches, lines, and irregular hues of color that covered them. Yet all of them remained ephemeral and meaningless like the whimsical daydreams of spring.
Then she saw a gossamer-like beam and a clear glimpse of the starry skies unhindered by the Barrier.
She witnessed Talos.

Time did not bring sunrise to the polar regions of Talos-II. The huge, new world dominated everyone's view and it gripped her soul with a power that far exceeded the Arts of the Witch King himself. She could not avert her gaze. She could not have imagined how this natural-occurring astronomical entity enraptured her just as knowledge and wealth had seized her every attention. In fact, she was not sure if this view of the Universe could be classified as a natural phenomenon.
She took her time to inspect Talos. It was a massive yet almost motionless orb veiled in pale blue and decorated with rings that resembled the fringes of petals, like lovely ribbons that she only saw from her aunt's sewing machine. As she looked on, she realized that the "motionlessness" of Talos was a visual trick it played on her. It moved at an almost imperceivable pace and shimmered ever so gently. She could hear the wind.
However, the motions stopped quickly and Talos became an unmoving giant once more. Her heart raced as irregular explosions of thoughts, memories, and ideas surged through her mind. She remembered handing in her first Arts exam when she was still a girl and the moment when she completed her advanced studies at the Spire. She saw her parents, her mentor, the hand that reached out from the devastated ruins, and the flowing sands in the far distance. The last things she saw as she steadied her gait by the dark coastline were her own face, the skies of Leithanien, and childhood friends who counted the stars with her. All of them wore her own face.
For the first time in her life, she felt the powerful impulse of passionate love. Her heart yearned for Talos and she would do anything to touch the giant.
It was her belief that the giant celestial body was the knot that tied everything together.
And these ties made the Originium flowing within her whisper into a chorus.
That was the day when she stopped changing. She must become a long-lived one, like the world she had hopelessly fallen in love with.

weaponDesc.cn:
我正被一名山丘般的萨卡兹战士单手拎起，走向塞什卡的某个角落。
周围的小孩兴奋地指着我们，和他们的父母激动地交流，或许是把我们误会成“诸王庭的游行”期间与各位“王庭之主”近距离互动的一环了。
想起父亲第一次带着我来到这座空中乐园的时候，我也是这般兴奋。
而现在，我似乎很快就要被眼前这个看不出悲喜的、沉默不语的战士处以极刑了。
“我、我不该逃票的！”
“……”
我是否会像那部记不起名字的老电影演的一样，被一位优雅的血魔提取出所有的血液，盛满他晚餐前的酒杯？
“我、我小时候来这里玩过，最喜欢的就是‘游侠大冒险’了！我只是想重温一下儿时的美好回忆！”
“……”
我是否会像小时候人手一本的《卡兹戴尔战记》漫画里提到的那样，被一人高的巨剑大卸八块，投入某座熔炉之中，成为燃料，化作滚烫的尘埃撒向空中？
“我、我不该趁着检票区人满为患时，从疲于应对孩子们的父母口袋中顺走那些金票！我错了！”
“……”
这不管用。难道说，我真正的企图早已被隐居在这座巫术迷城的某位独眼巨人所预见？那就全完了，为我的小命着想，我还是从实招来吧！
“我认罪，我认罪！我实在是没钱了！我确实怀有某种……犯罪企图，比如说，趁着塞什卡开放日结束的最后时刻，偷偷地从巫术时刻的品牌总店带走一把设计师本人签名的‘破碎君王’！但这只是我心中的邪念罢了！我才刚进塞什卡就被您逮着了！这一切仍未发生，我发誓！我保证！！”
“人我带到了，够聒噪的。”
砰的一声，我摔倒在一片漆黑之中。我小心翼翼地睁开双眼，发现自己落在一张精致、柔软的沙发上，而非预想中的地牢砖面。
“欢迎您的归来，勇敢的游侠。”
一位西装革履，佩戴游行假面的萨卡兹坐在我面前的古朴石桌后，念出了我儿时曾通关无数遍的“游侠大冒险”的经典台词。

“来自艾什柏环岛的马克西姆先生，距离您上一次光临塞什卡已经十六年了。但，属于您的奖品，我们一直为您留着。”
不对，“游侠大冒险”的主持人不是会穿上复古的礼服，扮演神秘的巫术预言者吗？还没等我想明白，那些不愿触及的回忆就一口气涌了上来。
上一次通关“游侠大冒险”的时候，我终于可以换取最终的“魔王大奖”——一把巧夺天工的玩具佩剑，它曾让儿时的我魂牵梦绕。然而，开放日结束的钟声响起，我错过了那天最后的兑换时机。父亲安慰我，等到下次塞什卡飞回来的时候，再来一次就好。
我没等到塞什卡重新降临菈梵朵玛的日子，等到的是父亲告诉我，我们如今一贫如洗，要搬去艾什柏环岛“避避风头”。再之后，我当然没能成为什么无畏的游侠，陪伴着我的只剩下扒窃、走私和诈骗……直到我今天为了赚笔大的，故地重游。
萨卡兹将石桌上的帷布掀开，里面并不是什么按下按钮就会发光的玩具佩剑，而是那把“破碎君王”！一把真正的，由巫术工匠精心打造的利刃！不仅如此，她还当着我的面凭空变出一支笔，签上了名。
“您……您确定，我十六年前落下的奖品……就是这把贵重的武器吗？”
“是的，一柄属于游侠的武器，正如预言揭示。”
“预言……我能斗胆请求您再揭示一个预言吗？”
“我愿聆听。”
“我的生活……会变好吗？”
萨卡兹看着我，她说了些什么，但我的耳中只有时隔十六年后再次响起的，宣告开放日结束的钟声。当我回过神时，双脚已经重新踏上了坚实的地面。人群簇拥着我，他们——孩子们，大人们，许多种族的人们——正抬起头，对放着烟花的塞什卡挥手告别。我像个孩子一样攥紧了手中的剑，我多希望钟声晚一点再响起，我多希望这把剑只要按下一个按钮就会发光。
不，我已经得到了我想要的东西，而我也知道接下来该怎么做。
游侠的冒险要开始了。
weaponDesc.en:
The Sarkaz was a mountain. He picked me up with one hand and stomped towards a less conspicuous place in Seš'qa.
The children nearby pointed at us excitedly. They jabbered to their parents about what they saw and probably mistook this altercation as an audience moment featured in the "Parade of the Royal Courts". I was the "lucky" guy who got to interact with the Kings of the Royal Court.
I was also just as excited when my old man brought me to this flying theme park for the first time.
But now, it felt as though I was about to be executed by this emotionless and silent Sarkaz warrior.
"SORRY! I should've bought a ticket!"
"..."
I didn't know if I would end up like the victim shown in the oldies. I could not remember its title, but the poor lad was completely drained of all his blood by an elegant Vampire to fill his dinner goblet.
"I ... I had fun at this place when I was a kid! 'Errant's Grand Adventure' was my favorite attraction! I just wanna relive my childhood again!"
"..."
I wondered if I would end up like the guy shown in super popular "Records of the Kazdelian Wars" manga. The dude was chopped to pieces by a sword as long as the dude himself, thrown into a furnace for fuel, and burned to raging hot ash that scattered to the winds!
"NO! PLEASE! I CONFESS! I pick-pocketed parents distracted by screaming kids when they crowded up at the ticket booths! I'M SORRY!"
"..."
That did not work. Perhaps my real intent was already foretold by a Cyclops who secretly dwelt in this City of Witchcraft. That would be the end of me! To hold on to dear life, I decided to spill everything!
"STAAAAHHHP! I'LL TELL YOU THE TRUTH! I'm completely broke! And I'm a ... a damn criminal! I might have schemed to steal a creator-signed 'Sundered Prince' from the Witching Hour flagship store just before Seš'qa Open Day ends! But that's just an evil plot! You caught me right after I stepped into Seš'qa! None of my plot ever happened! I PROMISE! I SWEAR!"
"Here's the guy. A real squealer this one."
I crumpled to the floor with a resounding thud. The room was dark. I carefully opened my eyes and found myself upon a soft and well-fashioned sofa instead of the cold, hard floors of a dungeon.
"Welcome back, my brave adventurer."
A Sarkaz recited the classic line of Errant's Grand Adventure as she took the seat behind a simple stone table. She was decked out in a fine business suit, leather shoes, and a parade mask.

"Mr. Maxim from Asphalt Roundabout. Sixteen years have passed since you last visited Seš'qa. Nevertheless, we have held on to your prize."
Wait. I thought the host of the "Errant's Grand Adventure" was supposed to roleplay as a mysterious diviner witch wearing an ancient courtly dress. Before I could sort out my confusion, a load of bad memories that I had always avoided suddenly surged within me.
I completed the "Errant's Grand Adventure" and could finally exchange my winnings for the final "Treasure from the Lord of Fiends" — a most intricately crafted toy sword. It was my childhood obsession. But I missed the final window for prize exchange when the bells tolled and signaled the end of the Open Day. My old man tried to comfort me and said we'd visit again when the flying city of Seš'qa returns.
But our days at La Fantoma didn't last till the return of Seš'qa. My old man told me that we were broke and gotta head to the Asphalt Roundabout to "dodge the collectors". Of course, I never became a fearless adventurer. Instead, I turned into a petty thief, a dirty smuggler, and a scummy fraud... I only revisited this place because I thought there was a killing to be made.
The Sarkaz then removed the cloth to reveal the prize under it. It sure wasn't a toy sword that blinked and flickered when you pressed a button. It was an actual "Sundered Prince"! An authentic blade painstakingly fashioned by the witch-crafters! Not only that, the Sarkaz manifested a pen out of thin air and signed the weapon for me.
"Are ... are you sure? That prize I missed sixteen years ago... It can't be a weapon of such immense value!"
"I am quite certain. A weapon of a true adventurer, just as revealed by the divination."
"A divination...? Could I ... beg you to divine another reading for me?"
"I'm listening."
"Will my life ... ever get better?"
The Sarkaz looked at me and said something, but the only sound that filled my ears were the tolling of bells that signaled the end of the Open Day that I had not heard for sixteen long years. When I returned to my senses, my legs once again found solid ground. People crowded around me. Everyone, children and grown-ups of every race, looked into the air and waved their goodbyes at the Seš'qa amidst the erupting fireworks. I felt like a young boy again as I gripped my blade. I hoped that the bells tolled a little later. I wanted a sword that flickered and shone when I pressed a button.
But no. I received something that I wanted and I knew exactly what to do.
My grand adventure was about to begin.

“……我知道你在想什么，新兵。你在想这个老菲林怎么能这么冷血又不讲道理，竟然让几个才训练了两个月的新兵去杀天使！但这就是命令！我只想从你们的嘴里听到那句‘是，长官’！明白吗？！”
“难道还需要我再向你们强调一遍吗？我是你们的教官，是你们的‘淬火者’，我的工作只有一件，那就是让你们能尽早搞清楚，和天使的作战从不是闹着玩的过家家游戏！”
“我不介意你们现在恨我，因为你们迟早会在未来……感谢我——”

“——卡！”

回过神的时候，我就知道自己又在同一段戏上卡壳了。
接着就看见路德导演气势汹汹地冲过来，指着我的鼻子大骂：
“赫德森先生！你的嘴是被驮兽踩过了吗！这么简单的一段台词都讲不好？已经是第三次了，先生！如果下次还过不了，那就请你立刻、马上从我的片场滚出去！”

…………

回到休息室，我的经纪人丹尼克显然有些难以接受，皱着眉问我：“卢卡斯，你到底在想什么？新蓝卡坞戏剧学院的高材生可不该是这种水平！”
我沉默了片刻，拿出那册被我写满了批注的剧本，指着上面画了圈的“盖伊·克里勒”——这名由我扮演的铁誓军军官的名字。
“盖伊·克里勒，一位品行高洁的铁誓军军人，在这个系列的上一部，他还是个会因新兵受到不公正待遇挺身而出，会质疑上级不合理安排的温和教官。
“但在这一部的剧本里，他自负、刻薄，将新兵视作比自己低等的消耗品，蔑视那些表现糟糕的新兵……”

“……你想说什么？”丹尼克有些不以为然，似乎对我说的话毫无兴趣。

我叹了口气，尝试认真地将自己的想法传达给他，传达给这个曾经把“我可是你的头号粉丝”挂在嘴边的人。
“我的意思是，这版剧本对这个角色的塑造存在很大问题。《铁旗队》这个系列已经拍了三部，而作为续作，对于这样一个关键配角的塑造不该这么草率，况且他还是故事中用来代表铁誓军形象的重要角色，我觉得我们不该——”

“能不能别再说这么矫情的话了？卢卡斯，还以为自己是在戏剧学院念书吗？”
丹尼克不耐烦地打断了我，以一种我非常熟悉但本以为不会在他脸上看见的尖酸表情望着我。
“看清楚点！这里不是你老师的表演课！
“什么角色塑造，什么剧本好坏——要操心也有导演、编剧、制片那么一大堆人操心，轮不到你！
“还提什么‘铁誓军形象’……你不知道这个系列为铁誓军吸引了多少新兵吗？我看他们可没什么反对意见！
“清醒点吧！新蓝卡坞不需要一个连自己位置都找不清楚的演员！
“你必须得想通这件事，然后咱们赶紧把那段戏过了！”

我看了丹尼克一眼，不得不承认他说的话……确实是有他的道理。

的确，我不过是个刚入行没多久的演员，决定不了任何事。
去过最远的城市是工团的特里格拉夫，所谓的“铁誓军军人”更是只在屏幕和海报上见过。
只要脱下身上这套戏服，什么天使，什么北方要塞，什么铁誓军精神……都和我扯不上任何关系。
——不是吗？

但，我看着这身据说是专门找了退役的铁誓军军人监修过的，连料子都和真正的军装一模一样的军官戏服，看着上面那个象征了“远征”的醒目徽记。
只觉得内心深处有什么过于炽热的东西正在缓缓涌动。

于是我抬起头，平静地看向了我的第一个也将会是最后一个经纪人。
“对不起，丹尼克，我想你是对的。
“在这个地方，我确实已经找不到属于我的位置了……
“所以，我也成为不了适合这里的‘盖伊·克里勒’。
“——再见。”

就这样，我将经纪人、解约协议与违约金都留在了那间休息室。
随即一个人离开了片场。

…………

半个月后，处理好所有相关事宜的我便拎上自己的行李，在新蓝卡坞最大的长途运输站买好了前往北方的票。

——后来？
后来我就来了这里，填写了一份参军申请，经过一系列的测试和训练之后——
本人，站在了长官您的面前。
weaponDesc.en:
"...I know what you're thinking, flakies. Why, by Talos, is this old feline so cold and unreasonable? Why would he send fresh meat with barely two weeks of training to kill some buggerloids? BECAUSE I ORDERED IT! The only blightery I wanna hear from your pie holes are: "SIR! YES, SIR!" Do you friggin' UNDERSTAND?!"
"Or do I have to emphasize this once more? I am your drill instructor! I am the smelter and the quencher! My job description has but one line, and that is to hammer this idea into your empty heads: Fighting buggerloids isn't the same as make-believe Saturday afternoon tea with Miss Applecrumbs!"
"I don't care if you hate me, because sooner or later... you will appreciate my edu —"

"— CUT!"

I got back to my senses and knew I messed up on the same line again.
Director Luther rushed over to my face, lividly. He pointed at my nose and roared:
"Mr. Hudson! Did a burdenbeast stomp on your mouth? You have FLOPPED three attempts for this simple line! If you fail to deliver this properly one more time, I want you to instantly REMOVE your majestically clumsy turdmaker OUT OF MY STUDIO!"

......

I returned to the lounge. Dennick, my agent, was frowning. "Lukas, what were you thinking? I thought you're a top graduate from the New Wrankwood Academy of Performing Arts!"
I remained silent and took out the script that was already filled with my personal notes. I drew a circle around the name "Guy Crerar" — An officer serving the Order of Steel Oath and the character I was supposed to play.
"Guy Crerar is an Oathkeeper known for his incorruptibility and sense of justice. In the prequel of this movie, he's a benevolent instructor who would stand up for his recruits when they are mistreated, and question his superiors when they give unreasonable orders."
"But what's happening here? Guy has turned into a conceited, self-centered jerk who treat recruits as expendables beneath himself, and under-performing youths as sub-human trash..."

"...What are you trying to say?" Dennick did not seem impressed. In fact, he seemed disinterested in my opinions.

I sighed. I tried to convey my ideas as truthfully and formally as I could to the man who once called himself my biggest "fan".
"I'm trying to say that this script has serious issues with the portrayal of this character. We already have an Iron Banner trilogy. The key character of its sequel shouldn't be handled in such a crude manner. Guy is also supposed to convey the image of the Oathkeepers in the story. Maybe we shouldn't —"

"Come on, Lukas. Let's ease off the sentimentalities already. We're not studying in drama school anymore."
Dennick interrupted me out of frustration. He then looked at me with this sour look on his face. A look I knew very well, but never expected him to show it.
"You need a clearer view of this entire thing! This isn't Acting 101. You're not in school!
"All that stuff on character portrayal and script quality is NONE of your concern. We have the director, scriptwriters, and producers in charge of that!
"And that stuff about the 'image of the Oathkeepers'... Don't you know how many recruits we're getting them with this series? I don't see anyone objecting to this!
"Look around you! New Wrankwood doesn't need an actors who can't even find his proper role!
"You must sort out this nonsense quickly! And please! Try to deliver that scene perfectly!"

I looked at Dennick. The things he said were irrefutable... He was making plenty of sense.

And I was also fresh out of drama school with hardly any say on the important things.
The UWST city of Triglava was the furthest place I had been to. I only saw Oathkeepers on screen and in posters.
None of the Aggeloi, Northern fortresses, and Oathkeeper spirit had anything to do with me once I take off my costume.
— And wouldn't that be the truth?

But they told me they found a retired Oathkeeper to check on the accuracy of the costume. It was even made out of the same fabrics of an actual officer's uniform, and they embellished it with the conspicuous Expeditioner's Medal.
I could not help but feel something seething deep within me.

And thus I raised my head and calmly faced my first and final agent.
"I'm sorry, Dennick. I suppose you're right.
"This place probably doesn't have a proper role for me...
"And this is why I'd no longer fit as the local rendition of Guy Crerar.
"— Take care." 

And with that, I left my agent, the termination agreement, and the fine at the lounge. 
Then I left the studio on my own.

......

Two weeks later, having settled all of my affairs and packing my personal belongings, I went to the largest long distance coach station of New Wrankwood and bought a ticket to the north.

— What happened next?
I came to this place and completed an application for enlisting in the Order. After several rounds of testing and training —
I finally earned my place to stand before you, sir.

“实验数据还是对不上吗？”
他垂着头，感觉到导师那审视的目光又一次沉重地打在了他身上。
接着就是一声更重的叹息。
“唉，子源，我记得你做这个‘息壤功率转换’的项目也已经三年了吧？”
他点点头，低声补充了一句。
“嗯，三年四个月零八天了。”
“那你知道你隔壁组的师兄，还有和你一样是做息壤研究方向的明枢，他们手上的项目进度如何吗？”
“……知道。”
“那我也没什么能说的了，你自己……再好好考虑下吧。师生一场，我会帮你留一个转项目的名额的。”

离开研究所的时候，天色已经不早，约莫是放学的时间，沿街时不时能看到几个小学徒结伴而行。
而他只是像往常那样，沿着方兴衢往里走，在第二个拐角转弯，又走了七八步，才踏入这家铺面不大的面馆。
“老板，一碗焖肉面，不要葱花。”
他坐在最常坐的那个位置，点了自己最常吃的面，然后看着店主也像往常那样什么都没说，利落地下好一碗端上了桌。
可才吃下第一口，他就皱了眉——只觉得面硬得不行，焖肉也腻了太多。
“这味道……怎么变了这么多？换师傅了吗？”
店主瞥了他一眼，笑了笑，难得接了话。
“年轻人，我家的面从浇头到面条全是我自己做的，和你昨天吃的那碗也没什么区别。我看不是面的味道变了，是你吃面的心变了……既然都没心思吃这碗面，何必要来呢？”
他先是沉默，随即摇摇头。
“老人家，你不明白……我做了那么一件事整整三年，坚持了整整三年，所以到了该结束的时候，就算没了心思，我也不想缺了哪一环……况且，这面的味道确实不如昨天。”
“哈，你这小子倒是嘴硬，分明是你自己舍不得，却还怪到我这面上了。”
他苦笑，倒是没继续争辩下去。
“就当是我舍不得吧，但我又能怎么办呢……
“别人的项目才几个月就有了看得见的阶段成果，探了骊也得了珠，只有我……一个项目做了三年，还是不得其门而入……
“再不换个项目，怕是就要自取其辱了。”
也顾不上店主听不听得懂，他竟然一口气将从没敢在导师、组员面前说的苦水都吐完了。
店主听了却敛了笑，认真地看向他。
“所以，你只是因为没能‘得珠’，就想半途而废了？”
“我……”他愣了愣，没能反驳。
“看你的样子，应该也是学材料的……那这三年你还记得你积累了多少次实验经验？尝试过多少种替换方案？留下过多少卷参考数据吗？”
“记得……353次、172种、561——不，算上最新一次，是562卷。”他有点艰难地说出了这么一串数字，忽然感觉心中一松。
“你看，这么多的东西，难道不是只属于你的另一份珍宝吗？”
“相较于最终结果，过程中积累的经验一样很重要吗……”
他有些恍然，若有所思地感叹道。
“说来惭愧，我当了快八年的天师学徒，竟然今天才因为您的这番话明白了这么简单的道理……真的是受教了。”
店主却是摆了摆手，像是想起了什么往事，将目光投向望不见终点的远处。
“客套话就免了，这里可没人爱听……我不过是见不得你这样的年轻人，明明还有很长的路能走，偏觉得自己走到了头。
“不像我那几个学生，就算真走到了头，他们也敢不要命地朝前冲，硬生生给自己再闯出一条路来……”
老人的嘴角不知何时带出了几分笑意，虽然很快就如面汤刚出锅时的热气那样散去了。
“只是运气都不太好……十年前嬉皮笑脸地跟我说‘老师，等我们去把裂隙关了就回来交结业论文’的小混蛋们，最后一个都没回来……”

“十年前……？您说的……莫非是……”

“都是些陈芝麻烂谷子的伤心事……不提了！
“唉，你小子傻愣在那儿干什么！还不快把这碗面吃了？
“等面坨了，就真要变味儿咯！”

"Still couldn't match the test data?"
The research assistant's head was bowed as he felt his mentor's judgmental gaze fall heavily upon him.
The gaze was quickly followed by an even heavier sigh.
"Hooo. Ziyuan, help me with my memories. Was it three years ago when I made you the RA to the Xiranite Power Conversion project?"
The RA nodded and gave more details in a low voice.
"Yes. Three years, four months, and eight days."
"Then what about your senior in the lab next door? And then there's Mingshu who's also working on Xiranite. Heard anything about their research progress?"
"Yeah... I did."
"I'm afraid I got nothing much left to say. Perhaps you can ... consider your next steps. I'm still your mentor, so I'll gladly reserve a recommendation for a project transfer."

The hour was already late when the RA left the research building. The last classes had ended and he could see groups of young apprentices along the streets.
The RA took the usual way to Fangxing Avenue. He turned at the second corner and took around seven to eight steps before arriving at the tiny noodle stall.
"Braised meat noodles. No scallions."
The RA took his usual place and ordered his usual noodles. And as usual, the stall owner served the bowl of noodles without a word.
The RA took a bite and frowned. The noodle was too tough, and the meat too greasy. 
"The flavors changed... What happened? Did you hire another chef?"
The stall owner glanced and smiled. He responded, a rare occasion at that.
"Boy, everything in this stall, from the noodles to the toppings, are made by me. And I made that bowl from yesterday as well. Perhaps it wasn't my noodles. It was you who changed... And if you're no longer interested in the noodles, why bother coming at all?"
The RA remained silent and then shook his head.
"You don't understand, sir... I spent three years on one thing... I kept at it for three whole years. They may have drew the curtains on it, but I'm not going to miss any step of the process... Plus, the noodles from yesterday were better."
"Hah. You're real stubborn, kid, you know that? You just couldn't give it up, so you tried finding issues with the noodles."
The RA gave a bitter smile and chose not to continue the argument.
"Maybe I couldn't give it up, but what could I do...?"
"The other RAs made significant progress in just a few months. They ventured in the dragon's lair and found its pearl... As for me... I'm still stuck at the same place after slogging at a single project for three years...
"I better switch to another project before this gets any worse."
The RA did not care if the stall owner understood how research works. He unloaded his pent-up bitterness and complaints that he dared not mention to his mentor or fellow RAs. 
The stall owner stopped smiling and looked at him with a serious expression on his face.
"So you want to quit because you couldn't find the pearl."
"I..." the RA was speechless and could not respond to the question.
"You look like material scientist... Do you remember how many sets of experimental data you've gathered in these three years? How many alternatives you tried? And the number of references you compiled?"
"I think I did ... 353 runs, 172 material alternatives, 561 papers — Wait. No. 562, including the latest," he remembered the figures with some difficulty, but listing them suddenly gave him a sense of relief.
"Impressive. That's a lot of data right there. I'd say you've created quite the treasure."
"The results might be important, but the lessons learned along the way are just as vital as well..."
The RA was a little taken aback by these words, and exclaimed these words rather thoughtfully:
"I've been a Tianshi disciple for nearly eight years, but it was your simple words that helped me realize something so simple... Thank you very much, sir."
The stall owner shook his hands and looked as though he recalled something from the past. His gaze looked into the great distance.
"That's enough flattery, lad. Nobody likes that here... I just feel bad when I see a fine youth such as yourself think it's the end of the world, especially when it's obvious that there are many wonderful years ahead of you...
"My disciples are different. They actually did run into a solid wall. But still they persisted on charging through and carving out their own path..."
A smile suddenly creased across the stall owner's face, but it quickly disappeared like the hot steaming fumes given off by freshly-served noodles.
"But luck wasn't on their side... Ten years ago, those cheeky brats had the galls to tell me: 'We'll submit the graduation theses once we seal that rift, sir.' None of those blighted little punks ever came back..." 

"Ten years ago...? What are you talking about...? Wait, you can't be that...?"

"I'll ending the story now... Just some sad, stupid tale from a stupid time.
"Hey, kid! Stop gawking at me and finish your noodles, damn your eyes!
"If the noodles drink in all the soup and goes soggy, you'll know!"

“耀骑士的战斗记录……多说无益，不是重点。她的高强技艺毋庸置疑，但大家心里都清楚，令她如此成功的根本原因并不是战斗本身。就算更换武器，改变战法，甚至换一个人，只要带着那样的理念在那个时刻挺身而出，切实行动，都能成为耀骑士——当然，这本身就已经无从学起了。”

“这个骑士……应该是骑士吧。这份录像是什么时候，从哪里得来的？不……我不确定……但我对此人毫无印象。画面断断续续，敌人也乱七八糟，但他确实很强，不知为何，我总觉得他真正的战场应该在……大海？你看他的身后……但他的身姿让我心潮澎湃，比起技艺，那股力量，那股愤怒，那简直是海浪组成的一首歌。对，歌声，我之前都在想什么？真相，联系……太亮了，好渴，渴，我要——”

“没了？”
“到这儿就断了，字都没写完。先生写到这儿，突然就不省人事了。”
“你说，先生都这样了，这份草稿真的没问题吗？”
“别想太多，任务就是任务。把先生的手放回去，我们走。”
weaponDesc.en:
"The Black Knight's imposing stature and awesome technique let her defeat other contenders without Originium Arts. Her attacks might look like powerful swings performed without much thought, but every strike was aimed at her opponent's weakness. The Black Knight always had an advantage in a frontal confrontation due to her superior footwork and balance. Several had claimed that this greatsword was not the Black Knight's favored weapon. There are tales of her defeating over a thousand enemy soldiers with her dual swordbreakers at Kjerag. Those tales would prove my hypothesis."
"The Blood Knight was even stronger and his tactics were widely studied. Unlike the Black Knight who preferred besting her opponents with a single deadly strike, the Blood Knight wielded Originium Arts to his advantage and manipulated his opponents to attack at a place and time that he desired. He was literally a one-man army who dominated the field."
"As for the battle records of the Radiant Knight ... words alone won't suffice. There was no question about her impeccable technique but everyone knew she owed her success not to the battle itself. Anyone armed with such levels of conviction could step onto the field with different weapons and tactics and become like the Radiant Knight herself. Of course, such levels of faith and belief would be impossible to learn."
......
"This Knight... wait. He's a knight, right? When and where did they make this recording? No ... I'm not sure... I can't recall this one at all. The video is choppy ... and it showed all sorts of enemies, but the knight is strong. I don't know why I have a feeling that his true battlefield should be ... in the oceans. Just look behind him... His stance and poise made my heart swell with excitement. When compared to his Arts, his raw power and fury was a symphony of the waves. Yes! The song! What have I been doing all this time? The truth, the links... Oh dear, it's so bright... I'm thirsty ... so thirsty... I need —"

"That's it?"
"That's where it ended. I know it's incomplete, but he suddenly passed out when he reached this line..."
"Is this draft really okay? The man did pass out halfway through his work, you know."
"You're overthinking things. This is our mission. Put his hand back on the table and let's get out of here."

weaponDesc.cn:
食腐者瘫坐在地上，面前摆着他的巨剑。
他已经在荒野上流浪了数日。回想起不久前倒在自己剑下的亡魂，那双绝望的眼睛，紧紧盯着他的双角。像这样充满恨意的眼睛他早就习以为常。不过是对他这位剥夺自己生命之人的憎恨罢了，只需要将他们吞食便能缓解他的苦痛。
他的双腿肿胀，灼热得像是要融化。不知不觉，他早就在饥饿与持续溃烂带来的痛苦中蜷曲了脊背。从父辈手中接过这柄寒霜时，他曾发誓要将它当作自己的第二条生命。但现在，他只想找个还有人迹的地方，用这位老友换一些净水和干粮。
但眼前荒废的聚落显然没有那种东西。食腐者起身正欲离去，身后传来了粗鲁的嘲弄。

“喂，魔族佬，这剑卖么？”
“……你们是佣兵，还是裂地者？”
“哼，有什么关系？要是你身手不错，我们可以连你也买下来。”

疲惫的食腐者没有拒绝，他稍稍握紧了双拳，估摸着自己的臂膀还剩多少力气：“怎样才算不错？”
“看见那个大石头没有？劈开！”
“看着。”
这块大石头似乎在这个聚落里有些年头，上面还刻着小孩子的画作，以及一些已经看不大清的字样。食腐者大概比划了下，似乎要两个他张开手臂才能抱住这块石头。
食腐者站直身子，用尽力气将手中的剑高高举起。然而等到尘雾散去，他这才发现，在那块石头底下，居然有个洞穴。
洞里闪着不安的眼睛，比他更虚弱，比他更绝望。背后的人们放声大笑，围了上来。
“身手挺好。跟我们走吧，你觉得自己值多少，说个数。”
“我是佣兵，不是屠夫。”

短暂的安静过后，依旧粗鲁的嘲弄从面前传了过来。
“不是屠夫？哈，不是屠夫！魔族佬，你们现在是发达了，但做的不还是刀口舔血的生意？少给我装什么好人！”
他们是对的。佣兵不是个清白的行当，已经夺走过生命，就不会有借口。
但是，洞穴里望向他的眼睛，望向他头上双角的目光，平静得让他难过。
十几年前，穿过星门的时候，他本以为可以不再看到这样的眼神。
“这剑不卖。”
食腐者深吸一口气，再一次举起巨剑。
“萨卡兹，也不卖。”

…………

疲惫与饥饿的身躯将食腐者缓缓拖向远方。
现在的塔卫二，还没到他能卖掉武器的时候。
weaponDesc.en:
The Nachzehrer crumpled to the ground. His greatsword laid before him.
He roamed the wildlands for days. He thought about those who fell by his sword and the pair of despair-filled eyes that stared at his horns. The Sarkaz was already used to the gaze of hate, the bitter spite against the entity that inevitably ended their lives. The Nachzehrer needed only to devour the haters to soothe his pain.
His legs were swollen and felt so hot that he thought they were melting off. Without knowing it, his spine curled together due to pain of hunger and unending rot. When he took the sword of frost from his fathers, he swore to treat it as dearly as his own life. But now, his only wish was to find an inhabited place and trade his old friend for some clean water and food.
However, the abandoned village had none of those. The Nachzehrer was about to leave when he heard crude, mocking ridicule.

"Oi, Sarkaz. That sword for sale?"
"...Who are you? Mercs or breakers?"
"Hur. Does it matter? If you're good enough, we'll buy you too, devil horns."

The exhausted Nachzehrer did not refuse. He gently clenched his hands into fists and checked his arms for their remaining strengths. "What do you mean by 'good enough'?"
"See that boulder over there? Cut it in half!"
"Sure. Watch."
The boulder was large enough that it might take two of him, with arms open wide, to fully embrace it. It seemed to have spent a few years in this village as it was covered with children's drawings and a few words that were no longer legible. The Nachzehrer studied it for a bit and measured his approach.
The Nachzehrer stood straight, and raised the sword up high with the entirety of his strength. When the dust settled, he was surprised to find a cave right under the boulder.
Pairs of eyes looked back at him from the cave. They flickered with unease and fear. They were far weaker and filled with even more despair than he was. The mob behind the Nachzehrer laughed loudly and approached.
"Hah! That's more than good enough. You're ours, devil horns. Got a price? Spit it out."
"I'm a merc, not a butcher."

After the momentary silence, the mocking ridicule erupted once more.
"Not a butcher? HAH! This one calls himself a non-butcher! You Sarkaz might have made your fortune, but you're still in the business of killing. Spare us the sermon, devil freak!"
The mob was right. Mercenary work was never clean. He had killed before, and he had no excuses for what he did.
But the eyes that gazed out from the cave stared hard at his horns. They were so quiet that it began to hurt.
When he walked through the Cosmic Gate over a decade ago, he thought he no longer had to see these eyes again.
"This sword isn't for sale."
The Nachzehrer took one deep breath and raised his great weapon into the air.
"This Sarkaz isn't for sale either."

......

The exhausted and famished frame of the Nachzehrer continued to trudge into the distance.
Talos-II was not yet at a state where a Sarkaz must sell his weapon.

weaponDesc.cn:
我并不能触摸所有人的心，但我至少能看透我自己的。
此时此刻，我的心中只有无边的恐惧，我们的科考站，我们为了战胜无边无际的甚大裂隙而准备的“观景台”，就这样被淹没在了侵蚀中，这让我感到绝望。息壤真的可行吗？我们过去的所作所为真的有任何意义吗？比起超域，人类还是过于渺小了。武陵会被吞没，万事万物都会被吞没，我们如何撼动巨物？
…………
我们需要挖一道水渠，虽然现在针对事故现场受灾者的抢救才是最重要的，但这道水渠也是必须的，它至少能保证地下水脉不被渗透进来的侵蚀潮污染。但这也没什么意义，只不过是早死一天和晚死一天的区别。
…………
满手水泡。就算我完全不懂工程，只是设备车间的职工，现在也要加入施工……本部的支援到来前，只能先靠我们自己撑住。
…………
手被划伤了，我在水渠工地挖出了一把折断的匕首，它在这里埋了多久？一百年？看看手上的血吧！不愿意直视的那根弦早就绷断了！父母妻儿都不在了，我也不再相信什么荣光和牺牲。我为什么还要活着，我为什么还要活着，我为什么还要活着，我为什么还要活着？
…………
明天就自杀吧。
…………
我选了深夜，在施工现场自杀。确实是个好地方，也是个好天气，大雨瓢泼，好像所有东西都泡在了泥里，我们这种失败者，就应该这样死在泥地里。
大雨冲垮了水渠尚未挖掘完成的部分。我在被冲开的泥土中，看到了一点点金属的光泽。不知道为什么，我走了过去，用双手刨开土，看到了下面埋着的是什么，那是一个锈蚀的阀门。
原来如此。
没有资料，没有确认，就只是最仓促的施工，极巧合地，我们挖通了前人未能完工的水渠。
锈蚀掉渣的阀门在那一瞬间变换了形象，它是我父亲的嘱托、我母亲的肖像，又或者是我祖父母坟前的纸花。
最后是我，污水倒影中的我。
原来如此。
永远有人想要活下去，也永远有人能够活下去。
天地并非无限，恐惧亦会被蚕食干净。
故我不再想着死亡。
我所延续的，仅是生命存续的本相，如此反复，千古恒常。
weaponDesc.en:
Not everyone's heart was mine to touch, but I could read my own like a book.
In this very instant, my heart is filled with nothing but fear. Our science station, the "observatory" we constructed to defeat the boundless Very Large Rift, has been engulfed by the Blight and despair did likewise to my mind. Will the Xiranite succeed? Is the entirety of our efforts completely meaningless? The Æther made us realize how insignificant we are. It will devour Wuling and everything in existence. How are we supposed to oppose this astronomical phenomenon?
......
A canal must be constructed. Although rescue work of victims from the disaster site is top priority right now, this canal is of utmost necessity. It will prevent the aquifers from contamination by the Blight Tide seeping into the soil. But this is ultimately futile. It only delays the inevitable death of everything upon this land.
......
My hands are covered in blisters. Though I'm just a worker at the production floor with zero knowledge on construction, I have been assigned to a building crew... We must fight off the disaster until reinforcements arrive from our HQ.
......
I got a cut in my hand. I unearthed a broken dagger from the canal construction site. How long has it been buried here? A century? By Talos, take a good look at your bleeding hand! To hell with glory and sacrifice! Why am I still alive? Why do I want to be alive? Why should I be alive at all? WHY?
......
Blighted hell. I'll off myself tomorrow.
......
I chose the night. At the construction site. Good place. Perfect weather, with pouring rain that soaks everything in the friggin' mud. Losers like us deserve to die and get buried in the mud.
The rain-swollen torrents tore through the last unfinished section of the canal. I spotted a metallic sheen in the freshly exposed mud. I don't know why I walked over to the glint and scooped out the mud with my bare hands. I unearthed the thing buried beneath — a rusty valve.
That was it.
Ours was an ad-hoc rush job with neither infrastructure map data nor verification. And as chance would have it, we completed the canal that our predecessors failed to finish.
My view of the thoroughly rusted valve transformed at once. It was my father's will, my mother's portrait, the paper flowers offered to my grandparents' grave...
...and me... I saw my reflection in the muddy water.
That was it.
Someone always wanted to survive. And someone always survived.
The heavens and earth are not without boundaries. Fear itself could disintegrate completely.
With that, I stopped thinking about death.
I but extend the facet of survival and persistence, the never-ending cycle that has endured for since time immemorial.

weaponDesc.cn:
“……我们要走了。听秦主管的意思，应该还是和以前一样，先回帝江号休整段日子，然后再看之后的安排。
“本来大家还想着趁这次把你送回耶尔什的……不过库恩说你跟他提过，比起雪山脚下，往后还是更想待在暖和点的地方。
“所以我们几个就去工团那里递了个申请——他们挺乐意为你做点什么的，于是就在这片公墓给你留了个好位置……毕竟按他们的说法，你也算是四号谷地的英雄了。
“你放心，你攒的那些电影票根都给你整理好了，准备照你最后说的，寄给你那个只在Baker上聊过的朋友。
“他挺关心你的，一直问我们‘十二号厅’是不是转行去了？我才知道你那个一直不肯说的‘退路’原来是去新蓝卡坞当场记……哈哈，确实是你会喜欢干的活……
“所以你看你，明明都计划好了，回去要多看十场电影，要去食堂请大家吃炸羽兽腿，要找武库工程师换一把新武器……
“最后怎么就……连犹豫都没犹豫，一个人冲上去了呢？唉……
“那几个你救下的难民都没事，那批物资也帮你送到了……
“你想拖住的那群天使，被你那一下炸得差不多了……剩的那几只，也被过来支援的工团哥们儿干掉了。
“总之……都没白费。你就安心躺在这里吧，我们几个以后只要路过了，都会来看你的……
“对了。这把大剑留给你了……我帮你递过申请了，它已经从‘紧急征用’那栏归到你名下了……
“你之前想换的就是它这款吧？没想到会在那种关头被你从那堆物资里找出来一把……也算缘分不是吗？
“那场爆炸里，它也算陪你到最后了……干脆就让它一直陪下去吧。
“反正你俩挺像的，都特别能扛，也都……扛住了。
“往后做个伴，也不那么寂寞。”
weaponDesc.en:
"...We're leaving. From what Director Qin said, it's just the usual. R&R aboard Dijiang while we wait for future assignments.
"Everyone wanted to take this opportunity and send you back to Kjersch... But Kuhn told us something you said to him, how you preferred a warmer place away from the foot of a snowy mountain.
"So, we submitted an application to the UWST — They're more than happy to do something for you. They left you a good spot at this public cemetery... According to the Workers United, you're a true hero of Valley IV.
"Don't worry. We've sorted out the movie ticket stubs too. We're going to mail it to that Baker friend as per your instructions.
"He really cares about you. Kept asking us if 'Theatre12' started working at a different place. That made me realize that your 'backup' plan is being a script supervisor at New Wrankwood... Yeah... That is indeed the type of work you'd like...
"Just look at you. Got it all figured out. Ten movies lined up at the booth, free crispy drumsticks at the canteen for the peeps, flashy new weapon at the Arsenal Engineer...
"But why did you just ... you know ... charge straight at them without thinking? Sheesh...
"All of the refugees you saved are doing well. We also delivered those supplies for you...
"That mighty explosion you pulled off blew that cluster of buggerloids to bits... The UW crew mates took care of the rest.
"I just wanna say that ... your sacrifice really paid off. Rest well, friend. The rest of us will visit every time we pass this place...
"Oh, and we left the greatsword for you... I ran the paperwork and moved it from 'emergency requisition' to a proper asset under your name...
"It's the deal that you always wanted, right? Never knew how you came upon it from that pile of supplies... Maybe that's what people call Fate.
"And it really stuck around in that explosion... Might as well let it stick around some more with you.
"Gotta say you're made for each other. Tough as nails ... and you took it all.
"I'll let you keep each other company. Keeps the loneliness out, you see."

weaponDesc.cn:
“塔罗斯会成为一座最最了不起的城市。”他的父母说。安德烈·斯洛塔利德，你要从学徒做起，先干体力活，然后去上学。长大以后要离开这个小小的定居点，去建设塔卫二的未来，和你的新家庭一起过上有意义的生活。
“塔罗斯是塔卫二的主星。”他的书上写着。这是一颗气态巨行星，在星门打开的那几年里，赫赫有名的斐尔迪南·克鲁尼估算出了它的质量，还有它与塔卫二之间的距离。在塔卫二上，星荚似乎不曾存在，他们在这里找到了更多星星，比泰拉的天空中还要多得多。
“星星在很近的地方，可惜门已经关上了。”他的导师说。如果源石应用专业的授课内容不能满足你，大可以去参加学院的占星家沙龙。除了算命，他们还探讨天文学，科学的天文学。不过，你对星星的兴趣看起来不仅仅在于观测和记录。安德烈，你想要造一颗星星，对吗？
“星星在你无法触及的地方。”暴力的诸多代理人趾高气扬。“不对，星星就在我手里。”安德烈答道，“先生们，我将向你们介绍本人为终末地工业设计的第一款施术单元……的原型机。”停在他肩头上的施术单元跃上半空，光芒刺入对方的眼睛，如同在黑夜至深处绽裂的骇新星。
weaponDesc.en:
"Talos will become an incredible city," pa and ma said, "Andre Zlotareed, be a good apprentice, learn the chores, and attend a proper trades school. Once you're a big owl, you gotta leave this tiny village, find a good job at the largest Band city of Talos-II, start a family, and enjoy your happy, cozy life."
"Talos," Andre read his textbook, "is the gas giant that Talos-II orbits around. During the few years when the Cosmic Gate was still open, the famous scientist Ferdinand Clooney calculated the mass of the planet as well as the orbital radius of Talos-II. The Starpod is seemingly absent on Talos-II, allowing astronomers to create star maps far more extensive than those they made by studying the skies of Terra."
"The stars are pretty close, but the Cosmic Gate has already closed," Andre's mentor told him. "If you want to learn something more besides applied Originium sciences, you can attend the astrologer's salon in the Academy. Divination is not the salon's only focus. They're also interested in astronomy. Scientific astronomy, that is. But I think your interest in the stars goes beyond observations and records, Andre. You want to build a star, right?"
"The stars are beyond your reach," the dealers and proxies of violence were always an arrogant lot.
"No. The stars are in my hand," Andre answered, "Gentlemen, allow me to introduce ... the very first Arts Unit prototype that I've designed for Endfield Industries." The Arts Unit perched on his shoulder leaped into the air and gave off a burst of light so bright that it resembled a hypernova in the deepest recesses of space.

weaponDesc.cn:
易用性、扩展性，这些都有点过誉啦……我有试着去询问过那些给过12正面评价的干员。干员们说，他们真正喜欢的是这款施术单元对照明法术的聚焦强化功能，出外勤的时候非常方便，就像随身带着一盏大功率探照灯。一开始，这些话让我哭笑不得，我该怎么告诉大家，这根本不是我的设计初衷，12长得有点像探照灯只是个巧合呢？后来，我参与了一次……侵蚀污染区域的探索任务。直到那时我才明白，当你孤身一人在暗处行走时，这样的光芒有多么宝贵。
——吉米尼在季度职务访谈时的发言记录
weaponDesc.en:
Ease of use and expandability are overrated... I tried talking to the operators who gave positive reviews for Jiminy 12. Turned out what they really liked was its ability to focus and amplify the brightness of its Illumination Arts. They said this made field operations a lot easier as the unit could also function as a powerful flashlight. At first, I found these Jiminy 12 reviews laughable and even tried to find a way to convince them that illumination was never part of my design goals and Jiminy 12's resemblance to a flashlight was a mere coincidence. However, when I joined a ... survey mission in a Blighted zone, I realized the usefulness of having a powerful source of light, especially when treading alone in the smothering darkness.
— Excerpt from Jiminy's quarterly performance review interview

weaponDesc.cn:
我们在一座无名的山峰上发现了这块矿石。为了它，你爸爸三次挖掘到力竭。但请不要担心，他很好。他最近有点缺乏运动。我们看了你的画，很高兴你能画出这么漂亮的施术单元蓝图。你看，这块白色的金属是不是正适合做它的眼睛？我们很快就会回帝江号。希望你一切都好。
…………
我们在环塔商会发现了一个天才般的设计师，然后从雷神工业手里高价买下了他的头号设计，打算当作你的生日礼物。抱歉，本来是想要给你一个惊喜的，但因为竞拍花掉了我们所有的钱，所以我们卷入了一点麻烦里。回帝江号的日子会稍微有点迟，不过一定赶在你的生日之前。希望你一切都好。也替爸爸妈妈向佩丽卡监督道声好。
…………
我们遇见了谢苗叔叔，也在四号谷地看到了你设计的手铳。我们十分感动。你爸爸怎么都不听劝，没走流程，偷偷拿走了一把。我替他把手续补上了。也请你替我们向佩丽卡监督道个歉。我很惊讶于这把武器大胆的设计思路，以及你在蚀刻弹方面的微小创新……不过四号谷地似乎先前出了点乱子，而你爸爸已经独自深入荒野好几个小时没有联系我了。请不要担心，我们一定在你的生日前赶回来。
…………
这铳真无敌了！宝贝！
…………
我们已经联系上宏山选剑局的一些熟人。他们会为你的最新想法提供支持的。不过，不要因为太投入到工作中而累坏了身子，要常活动筋骨，做早操。要听佩丽卡监督的话，配合她的工作。下一次回帝江号，希望你又能如愿以偿长高一些。
weaponDesc.en:
We found this piece of rock on an unnamed peak and your Dad exhausted himself 3 times trying to dig it out. Don't worry, he's fine. Old man just needed more exercise. We saw your Arts unit design drawings and felt really impressed. The white metal will make wonderful eyes for the unit. Hope you're doing well, sweetheart. We'll see you back at Dijiang soon.
......
We met an ingenious designer at the TGCC and paid quite a steep price for his flagship design from RAYTHEAN Industries. This was meant to be your birthday present but we spent all our money during the auction and got in quite a bit of trouble for that. Our return to Dijiang will be slightly delayed but we'll be there to celebrate your birthday. Hope everything's well, sweetheart. And don't forget to give our kindest regards to Supervisor Perlica.
......
We met Uncle Semyon and saw the handcannons you designed at Valley IV. It was so incredibly touching, but your old man spoiled the moment by ignoring me and "stealing" one of them without observing the proper protocol. I had to submit an application for him afterwards and wonder if you could apologize to Supervisor Perlica on his behalf. The bold design of the handcannon as well as your little innovation in the etched ammo took me by surprise... Something happened at Valley IV before we arrived and your Dad didn't contact me for hours after he ran off into the wildlands on his own. Don't worry. We'll be back onboard the ship to celebrate your birthday, sweetheart.
......
By Talos, your handcannon is a work of wonder!
......
I contacted my old friends working at Hongshan Swordmancers. They agreed to support your latest ideas. Listen to your Ma and stop those insane overtimes! And DON'T forget to exercise! Listen to Supervisor Perlica and help her achieve her grand vision. Hopefully you'll be a little taller when we see you next time aboard Dijiang.

weaponDesc.cn:
我在荒野中遇到了他们。
起初，他们对我并不友善。一位师者检查了我的伤势，允许我在此逗留，直至能独自行动。其他人则拒绝与我进一步交流。或许，这是因为我身着环塔商会的制服。
他们的生活方式……令我印象深刻。我认为这群人已形成了独特的传统，其核心是“节俭”，或更恰当地说，是“克制”。虽然他们的技术水平不算高超，但他们竭尽全力充分利用每一份材料。这赋予了他们的造物一种独特的“简洁之美”——一种由这颗星球的严酷荒野锤炼而成的美。
我告诉他们我也是个工匠，因此得以参与他们的生产。近距离观察他们的工作后，我发现一个令人惊讶的事实：尽管他们的产品用料远少于我们，生产流程也相当简单，但武器性能损耗却不是很大。这一发现让我意识到，我们的设计还有极大的优化空间。
我在他们中间生活了三年才离开。临别时，他们以师者的礼节对待我。然而，我深感自己从他们身上学到的，远比我教给他们的要多得多。
weaponDesc.en:
I met them in the wilderness.
They were not friendly at first. One of their Aldertones inspected my wounds and permitted me to stay until I became well enough to move on my own. The others, however, refused to converse with me. Perhaps this was the price that I had to pay for wearing a uniform of TGCC origin.
Their way of life left quite ... an impression on me. These people developed a unique culture centered around the idea of "simplicity". No. "Restraint" would be a better word. They might not have the best technology, but they made the most out of every material. These people crafted tools with a unique minimalist aesthetic — a style of beauty molded by the harsh and unforgiving wildlands of this untamed world.
I told them I was a crafter and it gave me a chance to take part in their work. Observing their craftsmanship up close gave me a rather shocking revelation — their weapons were fashioned using far less materials and simpler processes, but overall performance was only marginally less than our TGCC counterparts. This discovery made me realize that our designs actually have plenty of room for improvement.
I left the Circuit after spending three whole years with them, and they gave me honors befitting their own Aldertones. Deep down, I learned far more from the people of the Circuit than what I taught them in return.

weaponDesc.cn:
她清晨来到墓园祷告，中午离开，下午从事一些社区劳动，傍晚再回到墓园，然后深夜回家。我跟踪过，她的家就在墓园东南方向，最多一公里。和大部分众生长地的游人一样，即使在荒郊野岭，她也有办法怡然自处。
她倒是不抵触和外人打交道，听说有工团的人还和她接触过，大都是物资交易上的事情。
她看起来一点都不危险，年轻、温柔，甚至有一些羞怯。
但是，你明白吧？离这里最近的聚落估计得有上百公里，可这里有一个墓园，而且只有一个守墓人！
我确认过，那墓园里的所有人都和她没有关系。大部分是一些因为侵蚀事故或是天使袭击命丧荒野的路人。无名碑且不提，有名字的我都去查了，都是这些年的失踪人口。
别说开车路过的工人们，我现在都开始害怕了。
这活儿我最多再干一周。到时候把所有照片和录像都给你，我不干了。你不给钱都行。这我实在是受不了。
她肯定是个食腐者！
weaponDesc.en:
She would arrive at the cemetery to pray in the morning and leave at noon. Then she would do some community work in the afternoon, return to the cemetery during the evening, and leave the place only in the deep of night. I followed her before. Her home was no more than a klick southeast of the cemetery. Like most Songseekers of the Hannabit Circuit, she could survive the wildlands on her own.
She did not avoid external contact. Some of the UWST crew mates talked to her before to barter a thing or two.
She appeared young, gentle, and even a little shy. There was nothing dangerous about her.
But you must know the closest Circuit settlement was over a hundred klicks away. We have but only 1 cemetery at this place and only one undertaker!
I did my own investigations. The people we buried here had nothing to do with her. Most were travelers killed by the Aggeloi or Blight accidents. With the exception of the unmarked headstones, I checked all the names and every one of them went missing in recent years.
It got me spooked. In fact, even the truckers and crew mates driving past this place were getting spooked.
I'm quitting. I'll do this just for another week and I'll give you all the photos and video recordings I've made. I don't care about the money. I'm getting my sorry arse out of this blighted place.
She's definitely an eater of the dead! A Nachzehrer!

weaponDesc.cn:
蚀迹：塔卫二地质学名词，原指晶体表面受溶蚀而形成的规则状凹斑，现多指自然物遭到侵蚀作用而形成的各种痕迹。

“我想将侵蚀作用在岩石上形成的痕迹统一命名为‘蚀迹’。”
“你又在挪用已有的名词术语了。”
“不出五年，学生们就会扔掉从泰拉带来的旧教科书，转而学习我写的《塔卫二地质学》。到那时候，我定下来的才是正确用法。”
“你还是这样异想天开，真不知道该说是自大还是自信。”
“异想天开？我太喜欢这个词了。你怎么知道来这儿之前我主修的是航天，梦想的就是有朝一日骑着火箭飞到星星上去？”
“那怎么改行和我一起下地底了？”
“还不是因为那‘该死’的、‘颠覆了一切已知法则’的、‘不可理解’的东西！”
“超域？”
“还能是什么？这东西比天使要麻烦一万倍。我分析了捕捉到的所有数据，得出的结论是，星空中这样那样无法观测的盲点，都可能是被超域覆盖了。最近的……离这颗星球的距离就像你我鼻尖的距离一样近。”
“天哪，那我们岂不是……”
“没错，宇宙是危险的，在我们有生之年，恐怕都没法飞出塔罗斯的掌心。”
“呃……我的意思是超域会不会把我们吞掉，看来还是你比较乐观。”
“谁知道呢，总之我得在这之前搞清楚超域到底是怎么出现的，最古老的侵蚀痕迹离现在到底有多久，所以我就来和你做同伴了。”
“要是能弄明白这些，别说地质学了，物理学、天文学……连小孩写作文都得出现你‘卡蒂娅’的大名。”
“谢谢鼓励，那我一定不会忘了在扉页鸣谢你，莫里斯。咦？指数计有响动，那边！”
“我看看，哇噢！”
——一份古旧的录音资料

“这就是您老师的老师的老师的故事？伊冯干员？”
“确切地说比这还要早一些。这是他们的最后一段音频资料。”
“然后？”
“然后他们就再也没有回来。他们遗物里的第一块侵蚀冰碛岩样本，后来辗转落到了我老师的老师的老师手里。他从这里开始了研究，成为了‘超域研究之父’。”
“那您讲这个故事的用意是……”
“不是问我怎么踏上超域研究之路吗？向你介绍的就是，我真正的师承。”
weaponDesc.en:
Etch figure: Noun; geology; specific to Talos-II.
(i) A marking (etching) on natural materials produced by the Blight.
(ii) (archaic) A regular pit typically produced by a solvent acting upon a crystal face.
"I intend to refer to all Blight markings on rocks as 'etch figures'."
"Stealing technical terms again? Thought we're already using that to describe something else."
"So? Students in five years' time would have tossed out their textbooks from Terra and adopt my Geology of Talos-II. All the decisions I'm making today will become canon law by the morrow." 
"Imaginative as always. I wonder if I should call you confidently insane or insanely confident." 
"Insanely confident? I like how that sounds. And how do you know that I've started out majoring in aerospace sciences? I've always wanted to rocket myself to the stars."
"I'm afraid you're heading the wrong way, mate. We're now in the tunneling business and the only way they want us to go is down."
"And that's only because of that cursed thingamajig that 'defies all physical laws' and 'scoffs at every attempt to understand it'. Blegh!"
"You're talking about the Ætherside?"
"What else would I be talking about? Bloody glop central is a million times more confounding than the Aggeloi. I analyzed all the data we've scrounged together and my conclusion is that all the unobservable blind spots in the Universe may very well be obfuscated by the Ætherside. The closest one is just ... a hair's length away from this planet." 
"By Talos, does that mean we're..."
"That's right. The cosmos is a dangerous place, my friend. I don't think anyone from our generation could escape the grips of Talos."
"Oh... I was actually afraid of the Ætherside swallowing us whole. I guess you're really looking on the bright side of life."
"Who knows? Anyway, I wanted to figure out how this Ætherside appeared and get an exact date for the oldest etch figure we could find. This is why I decided to do some digging with you."
"Hmm. Qadja, if you figured that out, you would become the greatest figure in the fields of geology, physics, and astronomy... Heck. Kids in school would be forced to write essays on how your story inspired them to become nerds."
"Thanks for the encouragement, Morris. I'll definitely acknowledge you in my title page. Wait. I think the counter is responding. The signal is getting stronger ... That's it! There!"
"Let me see. Wow!"
— An old audio recording 

"Operator Yvonne, is this the story of your mentor's mentor's mentor?"
"To be precise, this incident happened before their stories began to trend. This is the last audio recording they made."
"What happened after that?"
"Neither of them returned. People went through their belongings and found a piece of Blighted tillite, the first mineral sample with observable etch figures. My mentor's mentor's mentor managed to get his hand on this sample and it started his scientist career. People now call him the Father of Ætherside Sciences."
"So why are you telling me this story...?" "I thought you were the one who asked how I got started on Ætherside sciences, so I told you about the giants whose shoulders I've been standing on."

weaponDesc.cn:
孩子，明天你就要参加结业测试了。这场测试的重要性不言而喻，它将决定你未来的岗位分配。我多么希望能亲自送你去测试，但我必须要盯紧侵蚀潮，这是我的职责。
我相信你已经做好了充分准备。不过，关于源石技艺精确度的测试，我还是要特别叮嘱几句。这个环节淘汰的人最多。如果你想加入应龙特勤队，这一关必须过。
测试使用的是宏山选剑局为武陵城特别研发的施术单元。它采用了息壤材料，因此其源石回路会和以往的施术单元有所不同。这将是对你专注力和敏锐度的极大考验。
当然，这些信息你早就烂熟于心。听说你们这些年轻人给它起了个绰号“莫奈何”，确实贴切。现在我们也都这么称呼它了。
为确保测试公平，我不能透露更多关于这个施术单元的细节。但我对你充满信心。还记得我小时候经常带你玩的木锁吗？虽然棘手，但你很快就找到了窍门。你现在要做的和那时一样——专注于眼前的挑战，享受这个过程。
祝你顺利。
weaponDesc.en:
Your graduation exams take place tomorrow, my dear. The importance of this review can't be overemphasized as the results will determine the job you'll be assigned with. I hoped to drive you to your exam but my Blight Tide monitoring job got in the way.
I believe you've already made all the essential preparations, but I must highlight the difficult challenge posed by the Originium Arts precision assessment. This is where most candidates fail, but you must succeed if you wish to join the Yinglung Special Task Force.
For this assessment, you'll be using an Arts Unit that the Hongshan Swordmancers specifically developed for Wuling. This unit includes Xiranite components whose circuitries change with the material. Wielding it would put your focus and all your senses to the test.
You probably know all of this by now. Youths of your age are calling this Arts Unit as Monaihe and I can't help but agree. You won't find another Arts Unit capable of eliciting more helpless frustration and anger from its wielder. The nickname even caught on with grown-ups like us.
I'm afraid I can't tell you more about this puzzle-box of an Arts Unit just to keep the assessment fair. Nevertheless, I have complete faith in you. Remember the wooden lock puzzles I bought you when you were a child? They kept you busy for a while but you always found a way to take them apart. Monaihe is the same thing. Overcome it like how you overcame those lock puzzles. Focus on the challenge and enjoy the process.
Good luck out there.

weaponDesc.cn:
我收到了沃尔特的需求，简直匪夷所思。我反复确认他是否在输出功率一栏多写了个零。他要的不是施术单元，而是便携式巨炮。他声称这是开拓前线急需的装备，但我不愿将如此危险的武器交给前线开拓者。
…………
理论上，达到这种输出功率并非不可能。我的计算显示，这是可行的。但风险太大了。我必须重新设计施术单元的结构……这会使其重量增加两倍。
…………
链式切割器？这需求荒谬至极。难道他们打算用施术单元去砸敌人吗？不过，按照现有构型，确实有空间加装。或许值得一试。
…………
战线推进后，沃尔特邀我实地考察。用他的话说……是去看看我的“杰作”。我希望他能给出充分理由，解释为何我提供的原型机连一片残骸都没带回来。
…………
那场景我终生难忘——一个如山般巨大的天使。它的残骸堵塞了整个山谷。沃尔特告诉我，他操控原型机撞向这个天使，用链锯在其表面开出一道裂缝。随后……天崩地裂。
weaponDesc.en:
I received Walther's specifications. Absolutely ludicrous! I had to double-check with the man because I suspect he wrote an extra zero for the desired yield. Mister blightbrain wasn't asking for an Arts Unit. He was asking for a portable giga-cannon. The nutcase claimed that he desperately needed the weapon to push our frontiers further into the wildlands. Even if I were to successfully make this mother-of-all-guns, I balk at the idea of handing over this dangerous weapon of mass devastation to the frontiersfolk.
......
Theoretically speaking, the yield was ... feasible. My calculations placed it within achievable limits but the numbers look risky. I had to redesign the structure of the Arts Unit but this would ... double the weight of the entire setup.
......
A powered eviscerator with a moving chain of cutting bits? Their demands are getting nuttier with every single day. Are they really going to smash an enemy's head with this Arts Unit? Come to think about it, the current build does have enough room for a motor. Maybe I'll give it a shot.
......
They pushed further into the front and Walther invited me for a field tour. To quote the man, he wanted to see what my works had "achieved". It would be nice if mister blightbrain could explain how my prototype vanished and how they failed to salvage anything. Not even a piece of scrap.
......
It was a monumental sight that I'd remember for life. The Aggelos was as big as a mountain and its carcass blocked the entire valley. Walther told me how he remotely controlled the prototype to ram against the Aggelos and how the mounted power eviscerator created an opening on its crust. The explosive payload was then detonated with ... ground shattering effects.

weaponDesc.cn:
我加入终末地之前，曾在某个聚落里待过。那是个临时聚落，工团和环塔商会对那附近有开发计划，他们共同管理那个地方。那里什么人都有，很破旧，但热闹。
有天傍晚，我看着几个萨卡兹蹲在我的房门口，他们都是工团的伙计，身强体壮，大多是感染者，会用点法术。标准的萨卡兹，我的同胞。他们赤裸着上身，吃着干粮，看见我，不好意思地冲我笑，为我让开一条路。
而他们不远处，就是另一群工团工人，也差不多的打扮，有说有笑，吃着一样的干粮，围着篝火跳舞，唱着各自家乡的歌谣。
“吃着一样的干粮”……
佩丽卡监督，您明白吗？
萨卡兹的处境和以前大不相同了。我爷爷活了二百来岁，经常和我说卡兹戴尔的故事。是的，塔卫二的其他人接纳我们，确实和爷爷活着的那个时代大不相同了。人们不会忌惮我们的法术，矿石病也因为那些医生和科学家们，不再那么可怕。我经受了和其他同龄人一样的教育，我也有很多异族朋友。而且，我和我的同胞普遍身体强壮，多少会点法术，反而成为了不可或缺的劳动力，或是对抗天使、侵蚀的前锋军。
看起来确实平等多了。所有工人都“吃着一样的干粮”。
可他们还是独自坐在地上，和远处热热闹闹的派对没有一点关系。
我有时候在想，大家接纳萨卡兹的方式，是不是通过“遗忘”萨卡兹来做到的？是不是通过忽视我们之间历史、文化和语言的差异，强硬构建起“平等”？
现状肯定比不平等要好。放在我爷爷那个年代，肯定有人骂我杞人忧天，得寸进尺。
但我还是要问，谁来保证萨卡兹主体的价值？这样下去，萨卡兹并不是得到了尊重，而是得到一种崭新的驯化……不，我当然了解塞什卡，但我无法完全认可他们选择的道路。
我相信终末地的独一无二之处，所以我选择成为终末地的干员。可我有自己的目标，佩丽卡监督，管理员，关于萨卡兹的目标。我很高兴能得到终末地各位的认可，也不会忘记我和那些游人们共度的时间，还有马丁·马文·马伦为我说的那些溢美之词。
但我不会成为精英干员。
至少现在还不是时候。
weaponDesc.en:
I lived at a small village before I became an Endfielder. It was more like a makeshift camp. Both the UWST and TGCC had plans to develop the surrounding region. The area was jointly managed by the two organizations and we had all sorts of people. Despite the shoddiness of the place, it was lively and boisterous.
I remember a particular evening when I saw a few Sarkaz squatting in front of the door of my cabin and munching on their rations. They were members of the UWST crew, but none of them had their shirts on and bared their stocky bodies to the wind. All of them were typical Sarkaz, Oripathy-positive and capable of wielding the Arts. They were my people. When they saw me, they gave a rather embarrassed smile and moved a bit so I could leave my cabin.
Another UWST crew with the same outfits partied around a bonfire not too far away from them. They laughed, cheered, and munched on the same rations. They danced around the fire and sang songs from their homes.
"Munched on the same rations..."
I hope you understand what that meant, Supervisor Perlica.
Life for my people had changed a lot. My Grandpapa had lived for over 200 years and he would tell me stories about Kazdel. The other Talosians might tolerate us more than their ancestors did back in the days when Grandpapa lived on Terra. People no longer feared our Arts and Oripathy was no longer the killer it once was thanks to the efforts of numerous scientists and surgeons. I have many friends of other races and we all received the same education. However, thanks to our innate skills in the Arts and our powerful build, my people and I either became indispensable forces of labor or soldiers fighting against the Aggeloi and the Blight.
Things might look fair. Every crew mate and worker munched on the same rations.
But my people were left alone to themselves. Every race had fun at that bonfire party. Every race except for us.
Sometimes I'd think that the way people tolerated the Sarkaz was by forgetting that we *are* the Sarkaz. Is this a forced construct of "equality" built upon a deliberate exclusion and neglect of the differences that separate our histories, cultures, and languages?
The Talosian condition was a vast improvement over the Terran injustice we endured. During Grandpapa's times, my people would treat my words as paranoid ramblings and unrealistic demands of a pampered and insatiable child.
But I must ask this question. Who can protect the integrity and values of being a Sarkaz? My people would not earn respect if things go on like this. Instead, we could become a domesticated species serving the interests of others... Of course, I do know about Seš'qa, but I cannot bring myself to fully approve the path they have taken.
I chose to become an Endfielder because I believe that Endfield was not such a place. I was overjoyed to win the approval of my fellow Endfielders. I will also remember the time I spent with the Songseekers of the Circuit as well as the kind words that Martin Marvin Malen lavished me with. But I have my dreams, Endministrator and Supervisor Perlica. I have my own vision for the Sarkaz.
And so, I refuse to become an elite operator. 
This is not yet the time.

weaponDesc.cn:
伟大的总发言人马克维茨为我们留下的，不是乏味、空虚、苦修一般的生活。正是因为我们面临困苦，面临侵蚀、天使与整个塔卫二的敌意，我们才更需要人类社会中不可或缺的东西——刺激！
小雅各宾说得很对，从书本到电影，从牌类游戏到电子产品，我们得幸保留了相当部分源自故乡的文娱形式，但为何我依然坚持这份事业？为何我一直在重提“骑士竞技文化的复辟”？
少安毋躁！少安毋躁！请不要造谣，我从来不是个泰拉主义者或是归乡派。我关注的只有此时，此地。你觉得我是因为怀念卡西米尔才搞的这一套？我出生的时候我爸爸连卡西米尔的照片都没留下一张！
恰恰相反！正因为我关注现实，我才会斥我毕生巨资，在家乡打造这样一个地下竞技场！
各位，我们已经不在高雅的泰拉城市街道上啦！各位，我们在荒野，我们在异星，我们在一片陌生的土地上！文学？影视？那些温吞的东西只会让年轻人沉溺在安全坚固的住宅里，难道你要让一群书呆子去工团工厂搬源矿，让一群近视眼去铁誓军的堡垒对付天使吗？
想想骑士竞技吧。对武器和身体的打磨，对源石技艺的极致钻研。这样尚武的运动难道不吻合我们残酷的现状吗？——换句话说，这话只对各位说——难道不会得到商会和军队的大力支持吗？
不不不，别说得好像我们在培养野蛮人一样。骑士竞技确实强调武力，但对自我肉体和精神的打磨，不才是骑士精神的最好展现吗？
道德……道德当然是必要的……但道德是赚到钱以后再商量的事情，对不？
得了吧红下巴，你自己说，你那个当医生的儿子要是更强壮些，他去北面就职的时候，你还会担心吗？
哦，你说得太对了。我甚至觉得铁誓军会投资我们……嗯。不妨这么想，若真能培养出几个擂台上的超级明星，也许其他合作方也都会为了他们抛来橄榄枝呢？我听说以前的卡西米尔就有这种先例！输出超级战士！
投资？当然……投资。我把各位父老乡亲喊来可不是为了耍嘴皮子的……直白地说，我已经找到第一批选手了。有工程师，有医生，甚至有土匪……不过他们都是一些陪衬，我相中了两位退役士兵，他们一定能崭露头角！
啊。你的提议也没错，这很稳妥。可是等到大街小巷都在关注我这场血脉偾张的赛事时，再想入局可就不是今天这个价了……算了吧，等到铁誓军都来投资我的时候，我可不需要你那点卖粮食的钱了，我的好舅舅！
还有人没有签字吗？很好。
既然是咱们一大家子攒的钱，竞技场就以我们的家族命名……不只如此，当骑士竞技重新风靡大地的时候，整个协会都应该冠以我们的名字！
——汉尼克协会！
weaponDesc.en:
The legendary Spokesman Malkiewicz did not leave us a legacy of boredom, dullness, or ascetic suffering. No! We Talosians have more than our fair share of suffering and pain! We have to deal with the Blight, the blasted Aggeloi, and an unforgiving and hostile world! This is why we need something indispensable to every community and civilization — WE NEED EXCITEMENT!
And Little Jakubin is right! We successfully preserved a few forms of entertainment from Old Terra. We got books, movies, cards, and video games. But why am I so passionate about this particular form of entertainment? Why do I keep harping all day about the Renaissance of the Majors?
Alright! Settle down! SETTLE DOWN! And enough with the rumors! I'm no Terranist! I'm definitely NOT a Returnist! Talos is my sole focus! Do you think I'm doing all this because I miss Kazimierz? NIE! My old man didn't even leave me a photo of that distant place when I was born!
NIE! My friends! I am a man of the moment! I care about the "NOW"! And this is why I spent my life's fortune to build this underground arena at my hometown!
People! We're no longer on the spotless and elegant boulevards of Old Terra! We're on an alien world! A new land! A WILD LAND! Literature? PFFT. Movies?! BLEGH! These nonsense make our youths soft and shackle them to their cozy little bunks all day! Can you expect bookish nerds to haul carts of Originium Ore at a UWST factory? Will you feel safe if the Order of Steel Oath garrison their fortresses and fight the Aggeloi with skinny lads wearing thick spectacles?
Think about the time when our youths fought in the Majors! Remember how they encouraged us to forge ever more powerful weapons and warriors! How it forced us to perfect our way of wielding the Arts! A sport that venerates our martial traditions is exactly what we need to fight and beat this unforgiving world to the ground! In other words, and this is for your ears alone — the TGCC and the military are definitely going to back us up for this great endeavor!
NIE! NIE! We're not breeding barbarians or brainless muscleheads! The Major is indeed a martial sport, but its aim is to hone our physical and mental strengths! Isn't that the epitome of knightly virtues?
Ethics...? Yes, it might be ... necessary... But we also need to make money first. Rake in the creds and we'll talk about ethics later.
Enough with your silly ideas, Redchin. I heard that your surgeon of a son was assigned to the North. You probably won't worry as much if the boy had more meat on him!
Oh! You're definitely right! In fact, I think the Order of Steel Oath will be interested in making an investment... Hmm. Think about this. If a few of our arena superstars get famous enough, we'll be attracting more than just one moneybag. That's what they told me about old Kazimierz! They created superstars out of their Knights! Super Knights!
Investment? Of course ... investments. Good people, I didn't call everyone here just to make you hear me waggle my tongue... Fine. I'll get straight to the point. I've already recruited the first batch of arena contenders. We got a few engineers, surgeons, and raiders... But these are just the appetizers. I found two actual veterans. They will give us the show we want!
Ah. You make a great point! That's the slow and steady way to go, but once I blanket every street and wall with posters of my exhilarating Major, the starting price would be way, way higher... Forget it. By the time the Oathkeepers approach me for an investment, I wouldn't need your money from your cereal trade no more, Wujek!
Alright! Has anyone not signed? Good.
Now since this pot of creds came from our family, it is only fitting that we name the arena after our family... And that's not all! When the Major becomes THE MOST IMPORTANT event in this world, the entire league will bear our name!
— The Hannicke League!

weaponDesc.cn:
前天，我外出拾荒的时候，遇到了一位奇怪的佩洛大姐姐。
她看上去也不像是之前关照过我们的众生长地人。她穿着奇怪的装束，还扶着一块报废的铁疙瘩，她管它叫“摩托”，说是被天使弄坏的。
她问我能不能把我的驮兽借给她。
我不想借给她。
我问她是谁，她说她是一个“信使”。
信使？从来没听过的名字。
她向我解释，在很久很久以前，当星门依旧伫立的时候，信使会带着塔卫二的东西穿过星门到泰拉去，然后再带着泰拉的东西回到塔卫二，交换着双方的思念和寄托。
可是爸爸说，星门早就坏了呀，早就没有泰拉了？
她回答道，赶走天使后，人们又陷入了战争与猜疑，都封闭了自己，就像我脚边的小沙地兽把自己埋在窝里不出来一样。
战争？
人与天使的战争，以及人与人的战争。她告诉我，我和爸爸的聚落或许就是为了躲避战争而定居荒野。
我并不想把驮兽借给她。
她直视着我的眼睛，认真地说，她向我借驮兽是为了去告诉大家，战争已经结束了。
虽然失去了与泰拉的连接，但信使想让塔卫二的大家重新团结在一起，重新信任彼此。
她是战争结束后的第一位信使，她要替一个叫“终末地”的人寄出第一封信——一封代表和平的信。
但我还是不想把驮兽借给她。
她温柔地笑了笑，将漂浮在身上的铁球摘下来，说这是她身上除了那封信之外最值钱的东西，可以先放在我这里抵押，直到她把驮兽还给我。
嗯，一般能漂浮的东西都挺值钱的。
我答应了，把驮兽借给了她，告诉了她我的名字，并给她指了指聚落的方向。
…………
今早起床的时候，有人告诉我，聚落外面拴着我的驮兽，上面有一封信与一件包裹，信上有我的名字。
果然是那个信使姐姐。
她在信里说，抵押在我这儿的东西就不用还她了，算是一份谢礼，感谢我的驮兽让她和信离目的地更近了一步。
信使的时代重新来临了！她的语气似乎很高兴。
包裹里面是一个“通信装置”，附上了一段说明，现在我们都可以用这个“通信装置”呼叫附近的信使们了。
可是我该写信给谁？又该寄去哪儿呢？我从来就没离开过聚落。
那我就先写给那个信使姐姐吧。
weaponDesc.en:
Just two days ago when I was out skavenjin, I met a weird Perro lady.
She wore a weird outfit and din't look like nobody from the Hanna-Beet that looked after us. She was also dragging some kind of wreck. Called it her "motor" she did. Told us that the rocky-crawlies broke it.
She askd if I could lend my burdenbeast to her.
I din't want to.
I asked who she was, and she tolds me she's a "Messenger".
Messenger? Never head that name before.
Then she expleyned how a long time ago when the big cosmo gate was still around, Messengers used the gate to bring stoff from Talos-II to Terra, and then bring other stoff from Terra to Talos-II. She sed it was an exchange of longing and attachment.
But Da told me the cosmo gate is gone. And so was Terra.
She replyed that after the buggerloids were gone, peepo lost fays in each other, started wars, and biult walls around themselves. Just like the lil' sandbeast nearby burrowin into the sand and not coming out.
Wars?
She sed people started wars on the buggers and on each other. She sed me and my Da live a wild-land villejj 'cos our peepo wanted to avoid wars.
Anyways, I din't want to lend her my burdenbeast.
She then look into me eyes and got really mean and seerius. She tolds me she needs my burdenbeast so she could go tell the others that the wars ended.
She sed we lost our link with Terra but Messengers like her wud try to bring everyone on Talos-II together and biuld trust instead of walls.
She then said that she's the first Messenger after the war and how she gots this letter of peece for a person called Endd-Fyodd.
But I still din't want to lend her my burdenbeast.
She gave me this jentoe smile plus a floating metal ball flowting close to her. She sed its mighty expensiff, worth almost as much as her letter. Tolds me I can keep the flowting ball as a dee-paw-zit until she comes back with my burdenbeast.
Yeah, flowting stoff is usually expensiff.
So I agreed and lent her my burdenbeast. I tolds her my name and showed her the way to the villejj.
......
When I woke up in the morn, someone tolds me that my burdenbeast is hitched outside the villejj. There was a package in the bag, and a letter with my name on it.
It turned out to be the Lady Messenger.
She wrotes in the letter that I gets to keep that "deposit" as a token of her gratitude. She also thanked me and my burdenbeast for helping her get close to her destination.
She said the Age of Messengers is coming! I think she was happy when she wrotes that.
The package contains this "comms radio" with some instructions. Now everyone in the villejj can use this "radio" and call other Messengers nearby.
But who shud I wryt to? And where should I send my letter? I never left my villejj.
Maybe I should wryt to that Lady Messenger.

weaponDesc.cn:
名为“会话”的修士步入荒野，
他来到一片荒芜的聚落，溪流干涸，土地龟裂。
饥渴的丰蹄们，向他寻求救赎。
“你们需要知识将你们引向那水草丰茂之处。”
“我来教你们如何解读这片土地。”
他手中闪烁着源石网络的光芒，
他传授着来自极远方之人的学识。
七个昼夜后，
明悟的丰蹄学会了如何在荒芜之中挖掘一口水井，
聚落自此水草丰茂。

名为“重现”的修士步入荒野，
他来到一片荒芜的聚落，溪流干涸，土地龟裂。
饥渴的丰蹄们，向他寻求救赎。
“你们需要力量将本属于你们的水源夺回。”
“我将赠予你们保护自己的武器。”
他将身后背负的数把铳取下，
他将这些四处收集而来的前人遗物赠予今人。
七个昼夜后，
武装的丰蹄将霸占了溪流上游的裂地者驱逐出了这片土地，
聚落自此水草丰茂。

名为“阐释”的修士步入荒野，
他来到一片荒芜的聚落，溪流干涸，土地龟裂。
饥渴的丰蹄们，向他寻求救赎。
“你们需要将信念凝聚在一起，祈祷丰沛的雨终会降临。”
“我将陪伴、带领你们等待这注定的雨季。”
他为众人划定律法与规范，让他们学会团结与忍耐，
他耐心地鼓励着每位绝望的丰蹄，给他们平静与希望。
七个昼夜后，
坚定的丰蹄等来了滂沱的生机之雨，
聚落自此水草丰茂。

汝若是那饥渴的丰蹄，
会选择接受哪一位修士的救赎？

——“三位修士”的寓言一则，刻于寂语移动大教堂的一角
weaponDesc.en:
The cleric named "Sessionite" thus entered the wildlands.
And he arrived at an abandoned village. The creek had long dried up and the soil was cracked.
And the Fortes, suffering hunger and thirst, asked him for salvation.
"You need knowledge that will lead you to where the water flows and the thick grasses grow."
"I shall teach you how to read these lands."
And so his hand gleamed with the light of the Originium Network,
And he imparted upon them knowledge that came from those from afar.
After seven days and seven nights,
The enlightened Fortes learned how to dig a water well in the barrens,
And thus the water flowed and the grasses grew forever more.

The cleric named "Resurgonite" thus entered the wildlands.
And he arrived at an abandoned village. The creek had long dried up and the soil was cracked.
And the Fortes, suffering hunger and thirst, asked him for salvation.
"You need strength to retake the watering hole that you once called yours."
"I shall grant you weapons to protect your kin."
And then he removed the guns he carried on his back,
And together with the relics of the old, he gave them to the Fortes he met.
After seven days and seven nights,
The armed Fortes drove the Landbreakers that occupied the upper flows of the river and chased them out of these lands,
And thus the water flowed and the grasses grew forever more.

The cleric named "Veritarite" thus entered the wildlands.
And he arrived at an abandoned village. The creek had long dried up and the soil was cracked.
And the Fortes, suffering hunger and thirst, asked him for salvation.
"You must converge your faith as one, and pray for a rain of abundance."
"I shall be with you, and lead you to wait for the destined season of rain."
And then he codified the Law and the commandments, and taught them unity and forbearance,
And he patiently encouraged every Forte whose despair was great in their hearts, and gave them peace and hope.
After seven days and seven nights,
A torrent of life-giving rain fell for the persevering Fortes,
And thus the water flowed and the grasses grew forever more.

If you are the thirsty Forte,
Which of these clerics' teachings will you accept?

— The Parable of the Three Clerics, engraved at one corner of the Sanctilamina Cathedralis Tranquillae

weaponDesc.cn:
我也曾忧虑自己该去往何处。我这体格，首先就考虑去艾什柏环岛参加地下格斗。但我被那里的萧条景象给吓到了，我可不想在那儿度过我的余生。于是我就来到了菈梵朵玛，这可是座充满机会的大都市，无数大人物来到这里，联席会议、论坛、展会，这里应有尽有！
…………
一年过去了，我花光了全部身家，买了一辆车，在一位好心商人的帮助下改造成了移动餐厅，也就是现在这辆。毕竟在海边嘛，我就管它叫“船”，“船”停在哪儿，哪儿就是我的“码头”。我还找了一些人来帮我打下手，当时正好是黑曜石音乐节，到处都是游客，遍地都是金票。
…………
两年过去了，越来越多的人像我一样，开着辆小车，接待着往来的游客。唉，成也黑曜石音乐节，败也黑曜石音乐节……你们说，这楼是越盖越多，怎么我的顾客怎么反而变少了？那一年啊，我还看见有一个菲林，和当年的我一样，花光了所有身家，但最后什么都没了……
…………
三年过去了，我当时也不知道自己还能撑多久，收益越来越少。最气人的是，经常把车开到我对面的那个佩洛，居然还跑到我这儿来抢我的店员，跟他们说什么我很快就撑不下去了……气死我了。
…………
我开始收拾行李，反正“船”上只剩我一个，开走就能回老家。但就是那年，菈梵朵玛发生了一场海啸。灾难结束后，一支终末地的医疗救援队来了……你说终末地和我这家小店有什么关系？当然没关系咯，但在一天夜里，我听到他们在说什么，很漂亮，像星空一样。我出去一看，漆黑的海滩上散布着被海水吹过来的贝壳，其中一些散发着一缕缕幽光。我突然想起，以前的音乐节也能看到这种景象，那时候人还没有现在这么多。于是我便有了主意，第二天就把“船”给抵押了，搞了一批会发光的贝壳，再加点装饰品，对，和你手上那个一样。然后？然后这里的“码头”变多了，“船”也就好走咯。
不瞒你说，我准备把这一块沙滩承包下来，对对，就你脚下这一片。然后把这些贝壳磨碎，搞个夜光海滩！名字我都想好了，叫“星砂海梦”。说不定下一次黑曜石音乐节的夜场就会选在我这里，到时候你们可一定要来捧场啊，我给你们打个折。
那个佩洛？不就在那儿吗，我们现在可是合伙人。为什么选他？这座菈梵朵玛，不就是做生意的互帮互助，才有了现在的样子吗？
weaponDesc.en:
There was a time when I was confused about life. The underground arenas of the Asphalt Roundabout is usually the first consideration of people of my size and stature. But the desolation of the place shocked me. That was not the place where I'd want to spend the rest of my life in. So I went to La Fantoma, a city of opportunities and a gathering place for the rich and famous! There are cartel joint sessions, forums, and expos! EVERYTHING!
......
One year passed and I splurged all my savings on a vehicle. Some charitable merchant helped me convert it into a nomadic resto, which happens to be the one right here. And I call it a "boat" since it's next to the sea. My "pier" is where I moor my "boat". I even found a few assistants back then. Made a ton of serious creds during the Obsidian Festival when the entire place was packed with tourists.
......
But two years later, I found more and more people doing my thing. They drive up to the place with their truck and started serving the tourists. The Obsidian Festival made and unmade my fortunes... They built more and more fancy hotels but I am I getting less and less diners? During that year, I saw a Feline who was just like me. Splurged his entire fortune and ended up with nothing...
......
Three years had passed. I didn't know how long I'd stay afloat. Revenue was dwindling and that Perro made it worse! The stinkin' mutt always parked his food truck opposite mine, and he had the galls to come over to my place and tell my diners that I was almost finished... I felt like killing that bloody runt.
......
I was the last one on the "boat". I started packing my stuff and planned to drive my "boat" back home. But that was the same year when La Fantoma got hit by a tidal wave. When the disaster ended, an Endfield medical SAR team arrived... How has this got anything to do with my store? It's got nothing with my store, but I strode out one night and heard the Endfielders admiring the star-like beauty of this place. I looked around and saw the dark beach cluttered with seashells brought ashore by the great waves. Some of them gave off soft, gentle glows. I suddenly remembered how we used to see all this when they just got the fest going and the crowd was still small.
