I suddenly had an idea, mortgaged my "boat" on the following day, got myself some glowing shells, and decorated them with various accessories. That's right. You're holding the very same thing. What happened next? Well, we got even more "piers" and my "boat" is coasting along real easy. 
I'll let you in on something. I'm planning to take a contract over this beach. Yes, that's right. The one beneath your feet. I'm going to grind these shells down to create the Evenglow Coast! I even figured out the name — Dreams of the Stardust Sea. Maybe the organizers of Obsidian Festival will choose my beach for their next evening event. Make sure you visit, 'cos I'll get you a fat discount.
What happened to that stinkin' mutt of a Perro? Oh, he's right over there. We're partners now. Why did I choose him? 'Cos business people of La Fantoma are all about helping each other out. That's how we made this place.

weaponDesc.cn:
我曾经十分笃定。
笃定自己在源石技艺（应用方向）上的天赋，即便放眼全塔卫二也是极为罕见的。
这一点，我相信从小到大所有教过我源石技艺的老师——一共二十三位，每个人都可以作证。
当同龄人还在学习如何用施术单元点燃一支蜡烛时，我已经在跟老师争辩感染者徒手长时间施放大量源石技艺的可能性了……至少当时，在我听说了那位传说中的管理员的故事后，甚至一度认为自己未必就做不到。
而我至今二十年的源石技艺能力测试成绩，进入学院后每年的源石技艺概论分数，乃至毕业时写的那篇《从实际应用到理论区间——论源石技艺的未来》所获得的赞誉，也让我在一年年的学习生活中更加相信，在源石技艺上，我大概确实称得上是个“天才”。
——直到我入职了那家我从小就无比向往的公司，终末地工业。

我无法形容我第一次拿到入职后例行的综合体检报告时的心情。
——源石技艺适应性是标准？怎么可能？哪里搞错了吧？
那一刻，我差点以为自己是中了哪个笞心魔的源石技艺，大脑还没清醒过来。
于是我直接去人力资源事务部进行了严正抗议，提出要重新进行测试，说我绝不会接受这么一个轻率的、缺乏足够依据的结论。
对于我的申请，人力资源事务部似乎并不意外。负责接待我的马丁·马文·马伦，以无比诚恳的语气回复了我。
“……您的诉求我们都了解了，那么会在三个工作日后，为您重新安排两场源石技艺适应性测试以示公平，届时会有两位干员作为对照项与您一同参加。”

三天后——
当我按照要求，用施术单元在面前的铁板上一点点切割出一个平整的正方形后，转头就看见本该站在对面进行测试的那个萨弗拉，正一脸好奇地看着我。
“原来能这么切吗？我还以为只要一次性切成十六个就行了！”
我承认我有一瞬间以为是自己听错了，于是不自觉地望向他那边的测试结果……十六个平整的正方形就那样规规矩矩地铺在训练室的地板上，计时器停在了1分01秒。
——那时我在干什么？噢，刚调试完施术单元，正想着该从铁板的哪个角切下第一刀。

毫无疑问，第一场测试是我输了，输得一塌糊涂。
不过当时我并未就此陷入消极，而是赶紧为第二场做起了准备，心想着“终末地这么大，又有管理员那样的传奇人物，偶尔遇到这种水平的同事……也是很正常的。”
但很快，意外……也可能是命中注定的情况就这么降临。
我在检查施术单元时，一个穿着精英干员制服的阿戈尔青年在训练室的门口探了探头。我看到他只是扫了一下尾巴，墙上的五十多个制式施术单元就自行解除锁定，全部跟着他飞走了，嘴上还说着“好麻烦……早知道就不来了……”
坦白说，我第一次感受到了书本上说的那种“令人绝望的差距”。
我很清楚，即使我学会了我所知的每一种源石技艺，我也做不到像他这样不留一点痕迹，做不到像他这样收放自如，做不到……
根本做不到。
我突然觉得，也许我前二十多年在源石技艺上的那点成绩，只是在某一刻让我比其他人更明白一点——我并非天才，天才另有其人。
第二场测试，我最终选了弃权。

那次测试后，我放弃了加入特种技术部门，好在武库要走了我的简历，问我要不要去他们那里做点什么。
我答应了。

听说，今年施术单元排障大赛冠军的奖品还是那款最经典的“术识”——我已经有了五个，但我不介意拿到第六个。
weaponDesc.en:
I once had extreme confidence.
Confidence for my gifts in wielding the (applicable) Originium Arts. And my gifts were rare indeed, even when taking every caster of Talos-II into account.
I believe all of my Arts instructors I had since my childhood could attest to this fact, and there were 23 of them.
While my peers struggled to light a candle with an Arts Unit, I was debating the possibility of having an unaided Infected cast the Arts for extended periods time and at higher throughputs... It was a time when I first heard about the legendary Endministrator. Back then, at least, I once believed that I might be capable of achieving the same.
My performances in the Originium Arts Proficiency Assessment for the last 20 years, my GPA from the courses on Originium Arts theories during the academy, and the accolades I received for my graduation thesis titled The Gap Between Practical Applications and Theory — A Discourse on the Future of the Originium Arts, only served to strengthen my belief as I spent every year perfecting my Arts. There is a significant possibility that I am a "genius".
— And I held on to that belief until I joined the company that I have dreamed about since my childhood. Endfield Industries.

I could hardly describe my feelings when I underwent the routine integrated physical examinations for new employees and received the report.
— My Originium Arts Assimilation was rated as "Standard". How was it possible? They must have made a mistake.
At that moment, I felt as though I was struck by the devious Arts of a Djall, and it struck so hard I could fight off the mental fog.
When I came to my senses, I went straight to the Human Resources Division and delivered a severe protest. I demanded a re-examination and declared my absolute refusal to accept such a brusque conclusion made without sufficient evidence.
The HR Division seemed to be expecting my applications. I was entreated by Martin Marvin Malen in a most sincere manner.
"...We understand your requests and have arranged two additional Originium Arts Assimilation testing sessions after three working days. A total of two operators will also be assigned to take the tests with you and serve as control references."

Three days later —
As per the instructions, I cut out a perfect square out of a ferric slab before me with my Arts Unit. I turned around saw the Savra who should be at the opposing testing station. He looked at me curiously.
"Is this the way to do it? I thought I had to cut 16 squares with a single move!"
This is my confession. I thought I heard him wrongly and subconsciously gazed at the results of his test... And I saw sixteen perfect squares neatly laid out on the floor of the training cabin. The clock stopped at exactly 1 minute and 1 second.
— What was I doing at that time? Oh, I just finished calibrating my Arts Unit and thought about the perfect approach to start cutting the slab.

There was no question that I lost the first trial. It was a complete disaster.
But negativity had yet to catch up to me. I simply prepped for the second session. I comforted myself with this thought: "Endfield's a big place, and they have a legend like the Endministrator. A fellow Endfielder of such competence ... should be something to expect."
Soon, an accident, or the stroke of Fate ... dawned upon me.
While I was checking the Arts Unit, an Ægir youth wearing an elite operator's uniform poked his head out of the training cabin. He simply wagged his tail and undid the safeties of over fifty standard Arts Units. They orbited him like an obedient school of fins as he left the place and mumbled these words: "What a hassle... Shouldn't have come here at the first place..."
This was when I first experienced despair from seeing an "unattainable gap" that could never be closed.
I learned that even if I mastered every form of Originium Arts to my knowledge, the tracelessness and effortless elegance of his Arts wielding were qualities that I could never achieve...
Never, not in my entire lifetime.
I suddenly felt that all my achievements in the Arts for the last twenty years only gave me better knowledge of what I witnessed at a particular moment in life — I am not the prodigy. That title belongs to someone else.
I chose to forfeit the second testing session.

After the test, I also gave up joining the Specialist Tech Division. Thankfully, the Arsenal took a good look at my CV and asked if I was interested in doing some weapon engineering.
I agreed.

They said that the classic "Arts Identifier" would be returning for the Arts Unit Obstacle Challenge this year — I received five of those, but I would not mind getting a sixth.

weaponDesc.cn:
“头儿，咱们这是要上哪儿去啊？”
“十三公里外的终末地设施，又一处次级定居点被天使攻陷了。我们必须去见管理员。”
“我知道，我知道，但我只是觉着，咱们一直在这里兜圈子啊……”
“天使掀了我们的车，专用的导航设备也毁了。要不然，一小时前我们就应该穿过这片丘陵了。”
“哎，头儿，我想起来了！杜宾教官教过咱们的！只要把长矛立在地上，咱们就能通过影子的方向还有太阳的位置来推算方位了！”
“省省吧，原来那套……行不通了。”
“为什么……杜宾教官的办法错了？”
“这里不是泰拉。你还记得吗？我们脚下的这颗星球是一颗气态巨行星的卫星。”
“哦，你说得对……那它，就是我们头顶这颗很大的行星，它叫什么来着？”
“塔罗斯，气态巨行星塔罗斯，我们穿过‘门’来到这里已经有些年头了。”
“唉，我可能是被它搞迷糊了……头儿，那咱们……还能找到路吗？”
“别说话，节省体力，你伤得很重。”
“头儿……把我放下吧，我觉得我撑不过去了。”
“不。我们会找到路。如果‘门’再也打不开了，塔卫二就是我们的新家。”
“哈，你说了算……头儿，你说了算……”
weaponDesc.en:
"Hey, baws. Where we going?"
"An Endfield facility 13 klicks away. We have another Aggeloid breach on another secondary settlement. We must rendezvous with the Endmin."
"I know that already, baws. I'm just curious why we're going around in circles..."
"Because the Aggeloi flipped our rover and busted our nav device. If we had one of those, we would have left these hills behind us an hour ago."
"Oh, baws! Just remembered sumthin'! Instructor Dobermann taught us this trick, you know! We can stick our lance in the ground and guess-timate our position by looking at its shadow and the position of the sun!"
"Thank you very much, but that method doesn't work here."
"Why...? Are you saying there's sumthin' wrong with Dobermann's training?"
"Geesh. Think! Use that thing in your head! This isn't Terra, genius! We're on a moon! A blighted moon orbiting a gas giant named Talos!"
"Oh yeah, you're right ... gas giants... So what is that huge thing in the sky? What's it called again?"
"Talos! That's a planet and it's a gas giant. We've been through the gate for years already. You should know all this!"
"Oh. Alright. Yeah, I guess it confused the hell out of me... So, baws... Can we still ... erm ... find our way out of here?"
"I would talk less and conserve my strength if I were you. Those wounds don't look good."
"Alright, baws... Just so you know, I ain't feelin' too good... I probably won't make it..."
"Shut it. We will make it. We will find a way. If we can't get the gates to open again, Talos-II will be our new home."
"Hah. You're the baws... You're the ... baws..."

weaponDesc.cn:
听我给你讲个故事吧，好吗，一个很简单的故事，就是关于我为什么一定要拿着这个破烂的、生锈的、终末地生产的、握柄缝隙里满是洗不掉的血污的长枪，不顾你们阻拦地一定要走出医院——相信我吧，等我讲完，你们就会理解我，而不是把我当成一个恋物癖疯子按在轮椅上。
这绝对是个足够简单的故事，我绝不会骗你们。四年前，准确来讲是1522天前，四号谷地安保队员中的六个，为了救援被困野外的一家而遭到了天使袭击——十只天使，十头没有感情的畜生把他们团团围住了，结局很简单，你一定能猜到个大概。

只剩下两个人。

只有两个人还活着，队伍里最强壮的男人，他赤手空拳站在自己战友们的尸堆旁，在他身后，有个哭泣不止的孩子，在他对面，则是一只半残废的天使，那个怪物用来进攻的肢体虽然断了，可它还能冲锋……啊，这可怎么办呢？这个赤手空拳的可怜人。
很快，他想到了办法，这要感谢终末地工业，对吧，终末地工业的这款枪可以自由拼组，于是……
他从队长的身上取下枪尖，从██████的断骨中取下第一节握柄，从█████的手中拿起基质模块，从██████背上取出第二节握柄，最后，他从妻子眉间取下最后一节握柄。
然后，他胜利了，带着孩子回到了四号谷地，将他的长枪传续下……
等等，为什么你们一副恍然大悟的表情？
我是幸存者？我将我的枪命名为“嵌合正义”？
我是那个孩子？我一定要知恩图报？
不。
不不不。
好好看看我手中的枪，它仅仅是终末地工业的制式产品。
那么，再好好看看我。
我只是个先天不足的病秧子，与故事并无直接关联。
但是……
请感受我的角膜、我的心脏、我的血液，听一听我体内为了让人类存续下去而奉献的灵魂，听一听他们的呐喊。
我无法枯坐于此。
我应是“嵌合正义”。
weaponDesc.en:
Wanna listen to a story? It's real simple and it'll explain why I insist on busting my way out of this hospital with this worn, rusty, Endfield-made lance with bits of dried blood stuck within the cracks of its shaft in my hands. You gotta trust me. Once you hear my tale, you'll understand my perspective and STOP treating me like a lunatic with a freakish fetish for this spear. You might even decide to release me from this jacket and wheelchair.
And I swear it'll be a simple story. Promise. Four years ago, or 1522 days to be precise, six Valley IV security officers on a mission to rescue a family trapped in the wilderness ran into an Aggeloid ambush. There were ten of them. Ten blasted buggerloids with zero sympathies for the living. The conclusion was simple. You probably guessed it right.

Only two lived to see the next sunrise.

Yeah. Just the two of them. The strongest officer no longer had a weapon. He was surrounded by the corpses of his entire team. The man stood before a crying child and stared down at a badly damaged buggerloid. Its deadly appendages were shattered, but the beast of rock could still charge and crush both the man and babe with its bulk. The officer thought hard... What could he do? He was without a weapon...
But the officer quickly found a solution, thanks to Endfield Industries. Endfield lances featured field-fitting modular components, so...
He took the spearhead from his captain, salvaged the essence module from ██████'s hands, acquired a third of the shaft from ██████'s broken bones, pulled out the second part of the shaft from ██████'s back, and pried out the final part of the shaft from his wife's very skull.
The officer emerged victorious with his new weapon. He took the child to Valley IV and the lance was passed on to...
Hold on. Why do you look as though you just figured something out?
Am I the survivor? Is that why I've named this weapon Chimeric Justice?  Was I that child? Am I doing my best to repay the act of heroism?
No. You got it all wrong.
Take a good look at this lance. A standard Endfield product.
Good. Now take a good look at me.  I had nothing to do with the story. I came into this world as a sickly runt with many broken parts.
But... My retina, my heart, my blood, and every fiber of my being are crying out... Listen to the howling souls that sacrificed themselves for humanity to survive!
I refuse to sit and rot at this place.
My destiny is to become the TRUE Chimeric Justice!

weaponDesc.cn:
这城里有许多家族。提起最和睦美好的，大家一时间还真想不起来，但要是说起最不和睦的，一定是韦伯家。很少有一个家庭，在有如此多孩子的同时，又有如此多的嫌隙，每六十四平方公里的土地上，只能有一个韦伯家的孩子，不然便会有暴力的流血事件降临这片不幸的土地。
上个月，韦伯家最年长的孩子在战场上接到一封信，杀死眼前的敌人后，他找到长官，请了一个月的假，踏上了返城的旅途。他走过林地，遇到自己的弟弟，在斧头砸向面门前，他将信里的内容说了出来。他的弟弟随即将斧子丢下，草草收拾了几样东西，便一同踏上长路。
河流的岸边，他们的妹妹已经早早乘船等候，她手里巨大的船桨让他们不得不一路提防，上一次他们在她面前大意，醒过来就是三天后了。
他们剩下的时间不多，但他们剩下的旅途还很长。
前方还有一片辽阔的沙漠要穿越，就在他们迷失于随时会变换形状的沙丘中时，一支车队及时赶来。为首的车降下窗户，露出一张他们深恶痛绝的脸——卑鄙无耻的小叔。从小到大，只要他们陷入困境，小叔必定不远万里赶来嘲笑。
“上车吧，你们这群小崽子。”小叔挥挥手，招呼他们坐上车，无视翻给自己的三个白眼。后面的车子一起响起喇叭，催促他们赶紧上车，吵闹的声音后不知又藏了多少个烦人的亲戚。
车队再次启程，只在沙漠中留下几行易逝的车辙。日夜兼程，他们终于成功抵达最后一站，丰水期的湖泊在暴风的裹挟下，翻起巨大的浪花，好在他们最富裕的姑妈有一艘坚固、宏伟的大船，足够把整个韦伯家族的人都塞进去。
暴风雨中，姑妈迎着浪头，昂首走在颠簸的甲板上，用左边的鼻孔鄙视了所有吐出来的人，用右边的鼻孔嘲笑了剩下扶着栏杆脸色苍白的人。在狂风的护送下，他们顺利抵达了家乡。
当天城内，一众韦伯家族的成员争分夺秒跑过主街的景象让所有人咋舌，从街头到街尾，浩浩荡荡，直奔最大的医院。
最终，他们齐齐聚在病房中，将一个还在襁褓中的女孩团团围住。女孩掀起眼皮，虚弱地扫过在场所有人，随后，那双未被世事烦扰过的眼睛便永久闭上了。
“谢谢你们愿意来见她最后一面。”抱紧孩子逐渐冰冷的尸体，韦伯家最年幼的女儿轻声道。
weaponDesc.en:
The city had many families. No one knew which of these families was the most friendly and harmonious. But everybody agreed that the Webers were the antithesis of peace. Rarely has there been a family with so many children and so many feuds. Only one Weber should be present in an area of sixty-four square klicks. If more Webers were present, the unfortunate land would soon witness violence and bloodshed.
Just last month, the eldest of the Weber children received a letter on the battlefield. After butchering the enemy who stood before him, he found his officer and applied for one-month of leave and embarked on a journey home. He crossed the woodlands and found his younger brother who was about to bury the axe into the elder Weber's head when the latter suddenly read the contents of the letter. The younger Weber tossed the axe, packed a few things, and joined his brother on a long journey.
Their sister was already waiting on a boat moored at the riverbank. The Weber boys were wary of the massive oar she wielded. Last time they were careless and woke up three days later.
Time was running out but they still had a lengthy journey ahead.
The three siblings faced a vast desert. When they were lost amongst the dunes of ever-changing shapes, a convoy arrived on time. The driver of the lead vehicle lowered the window and revealed a face they all despised and hated beyond all measure — Uncle Weber who lived miles away but never failed to show up and gloat at the family whenever they met difficulties.
"Hop on, brats," Uncle Weber offered a ride to the young Webers and ignored how they rolled their eyes. The other vehicles in the convoy honked and rushed them along. The frustrated cacophony undoubtedly hid a great number of Webers as well.
The convoy started off at once and left ephemeral trails upon the sands. They drove all through the night and day before finally arriving at the final stop. The lake was at peak water level, swollen by a storm that threw great waves crashing at its banks. Thankfully, the richest of their aunts owned a strong, majestic ship capable of accommodating every single Weber.
Aunt Weber the Captain proudly strolled the rolling decks as the ship tore through the storm and rode the waves, giving snorts of disdain to every Weber who failed to keep their stomach juices in, and grunts of contempt to the discolored Webers who held on to the railings for dear life. The tempest accompanied them throughout the journey, and all the Webers arrived at their homeland safely.
Everyone was shocked to see the Webers charging across the main avenue for the biggest hospital in town. There were so many of them that they covered the entire length of the road.
And the Webers finally gathered at the ward and surrounded a baby girl still in her wrappings. The infant weakly opened her eyes and looked at everyone present before closing them forever, untouched and untainted by the mundane affairs of the mortal world.
"Thank you for agreeing to see her one last time," the youngest of the Weber girls said softly as she cuddled the child whose body grew colder and colder.

weaponDesc.cn:
在此次前线考察中，我着重关注了基层士兵的需求。毕竟，铁誓军的每一位战士都是无价之宝。任何一个士兵的伤亡，都是对文明的重大损失。
…………
天使是一种奇特的存在，既无作战技巧，也无谋略。然而，它们不知疼痛，不懂恐惧，也永不退缩。长期与天使对抗的士兵往往会陷入麻木。这种麻木并非源于杀戮，而是因为他们面对的敌人宛如绵延的群山。
…………
我建议为基层士兵大量配备长枪，这种古老的武器在对抗天使时将焕发新生：长柄可让士兵在与天使作战时保持安全距离，锋利的矛头则能破除天使的防御。但我们也需要新的设计，新产品必须具备足够的韧性，除此之外，就是锋利，锋利，再锋利。
…………
我已将设计草图发送给总部。纵观历史，从卡西米尔的骑士到萨卡兹佣兵，长枪都曾是基础装备。如今，它又找到了新的用武之地。
weaponDesc.en:
I specifically focused on the needs of our rank and file during this frontline review. The life of every Oathkeeper, no matter the rank, is invaluable to the Order. The fall of any Oathkeeper, no matter their skill in arms, is a grievous loss for the defense of this civilization.
......
The host of Aggeloi is a unique form of existence. Though the host has no combat techniques or strategies to speak of, it also feels no pain or fear. The host never retreats and simply keeps fighting until the last Aggelos is slain. Extended Aggeloid crusades often dull the minds and senses of Order soldiers. The Oathkeepers do not detest the killing. No. They simply realized that the host of Aggeloi could crush entire mountains with their weight of numbers alone.
......
I humbly propose to arm our common soldiery with lances and spears. These ancient weapons will find new purpose in the Aggeloid crusades. The length of the weapons will let our soldiers attack these abominations from safer distances and the sharp, tapered tips should be sufficient to puncture their defensive shells. We must also design new arms strong enough to withstand the weight of these inorganic creatures. And the tips require sharper tips. The sharper, the better.
......
I've sent my blueprints to our headquarters. The lance and spear have always been the mainstay of every army in history ranging from Kazimierzian Knights to Sarkaz mercenary bands. They shall serve once more in our crusades.

weaponDesc.cn:
……综上所述，我必须再次强调武器应以实用性为第一要义的观点——77的菱形凹槽是绝对失败的冗余设计！您该清楚，我们的敌人已经不再是那些有血有肉的同类了，此后的设计绝不能再照搬罗德岛的那些工程资料。
美观？！您这是程度相当严重的侮辱。武器最重要的美德绝不是它的外表！如果我想做的是那样的设计，我早就跳槽去梅什科工业了！
——奥佩罗79设计会第三次会议纪要
weaponDesc.en:
...therefore, I must re-emphasize the necessity of making field practicality the prime design objective of any weapon — and that means the fuller grooves on 77 are obsolete and redundant features that serve no purpose! You must understand that our enemies neither bleed nor feel pain. Stop adopting design elements from those Rhodes Island engineering drawings.
Aesthetics?! I am taking that very personally, sir. The greatest virtue of any weapon lies not in its appearance! If I wanted to make things look nice, I would be working at Mieszko Industries and not at this blasted place!
— Meeting minutes of the third design conference for Opero 79

weaponDesc.cn:
我当然承认“美德”具有价值，我甚至无比支持这一点！但，先生，价值是可量化的。
忠诚与勇气哪个更博人眼球？慷慨与怜悯哪个更令人青睐？我们从不需要一位公正的裁决人，我们有更靠谱的东西——市场！我的先生，想必以您的年纪，还对那些屏幕上跳动的数字与惊心动魄的折线图有印象吧？哦！您曾跟着祖父去过商业联……？那太好了！多棒的童年回忆！那么，无需我多言，您该知道，所见的那些便是“美德”被量化过的结果：一份可交易的价值。
是的，是的，商业一定是独属于人类的智慧。哦，听我的，忘了那些对金融学尖酸刻薄的批判吧。我向来不在乎脚下的东西是球体，是三角，还是圆柱——只要在这之上生活的还是人类，对于我们来说就没有本质上的差别。在泰拉如此，在塔卫二亦是如此。我们从未离开我们自己，不是吗？我的意思是，您换一间屋子，难道还会换一颗脑子吗？
那些一门心思往前走的人把这儿描绘成一片险象环生的土地，但换而言之，这又何尝不是一片尚未被人涉足的土地！我必须声明，该项目的投资前景与发展潜质难以估量。推出“美德”系列装备只是这个战略布局中最小的一步……而我，您听着，我绝不是唯一嗅到商机的人。
在这片土地人满为患之前，在“美德”尚可估价之时……德里安先生，我保证，您今日在这张合约上落下的每一笔，都能在未来兑成取之不尽的财富。
对，对！就签在这儿……瞧瞧，我就知道您是个投资眼光相当毒辣的人——哦，什么？好的，让他到贵宾室等一下。
——那么，我便不留您了。
weaponDesc.en:
I do acknowledge the value of these "virtues". In fact, I am willing to commit my complete support for such values! But you must understand, sir, actual value must be quantifiable.
What does the audience like better? Courage or valor? Generosity or mercy? We don't need a just arbitrator when we already have the most reliable judge of our products — the market itself! Sir, a man of your years and experience should have seen the great upheavals when the index figures fluctuated and the lines leaped up and down the charts... Oh! You and your grandfather actually visited the old Terran General Chamber of Commerce...? Wonderful! Truly wonderful childhood memories! I'll just skip the things you already know. You should be well aware that everything we see is the result of our efforts in quantifying "virtues" into actual value that we can trade with.
Of course. Commerce is a field of knowledge exclusive to humanity. Oh, and I got something about that. Forget about the rancorous criticisms of our top economists and financial experts. I don't care if we're living on a sphere, on top of a pyramid, or a pillar. Makes no difference to us as long as the people living here are human. We never left ourselves. What I meant was that living at a new place didn't suddenly give us a new mind.
Those who wanted to keep moving describe this place as untamed and filled with dangers. But I see a land untouched and filled with potential! I can't emphasize enough the immensity of the profits we can reap by investing in this project. The Virtues-series equipment is but the smallest step in our great strategy... And I am not the only one who recognizes this opportunity. You'd be wise to keep that in mind.
Mr. Derriam, before they fill the entire place up with people and start putting price tags on all sorts of "virtues" ... I promise, every cent you invest via this contract will grant you incalculable wealth in the future.
Oh, that's right! Just sign right there... I knew I saw a keen-eyed investor who saw exactly where the killing can be made — Hold on. Got to take this call. Yes? Good. Have him wait in the VIP lounge.
— And that should wrap things up. Don't let me keep you here, sir.

weaponDesc.cn:
“名为泰拉的家园，位于遥远的星空中，存在于无尽的天穹之外。”
当得知整个航空器研究中心即将解散时，肖恩并没有感到难过。作为一名科研人员，肖恩内心的理性在过去几个月里已经成功占据了思维的主导地位。他明白塔卫二社会当前面临的困境，北进重工支援所肩负着许多重要使命，对天空的探索势必需要为其他更现实、更重要的项目让步。
但是在搬离实验室，整理个人行李时，肖恩看着书架上那上下两册《斐尔迪南物理学》，一种难以言喻的空虚与失落感在理性的高墙前短暂驻足。他回顾着自己过去的人生，曾经执着和热爱的所有事物，仿佛都像是一幅蒙着布的画作。
儿时听过的童话故事《夕娥的传说》，以及学生时代沉迷已久的那些描绘异星冒险的幻想小说，还有那位伟大的物理学家斐尔迪南·克鲁尼所阐述的物理学真理，肖恩始终觉得，自己的灵魂或许从未被束缚在某一片大地之上。
在过去的四十年里，肖恩的大部分时间都致力于研究那些常人难以理解的技术设备，如源石推进器、耐高温烧蚀材料以及特殊处理的压缩源石燃料等。他与无数志同道合的人共同探索触及星空的可能性。尽管他从未见过泰拉的大地，但他坚信泰拉就在那遥不可及的无尽深空中，而群星之间蕴藏着无数的疑问、结果与答案。
那天晚上，肖恩做出了一个重要的决定。他没有按照规定将自己多年的研究成果统一归档封存，而是带着数据硬盘和图纸，联系了北进重工支援所创新技术部门的负责人。这些高精尖的研究成果，凝聚了无数人的心血，即使再也不会有飞向群星的那一天，它们也一定能为泰拉人对塔卫二的探索提供帮助。
这一切必须是有意义的。
weaponDesc.en:
"Our home, Terra, lies somewhere faraway in the vast voidness of the endless space."
Shayen did not feel sadness when he heard that the entirety of the Aerospace Research Center was to be disbanded. Trained as a scientist, Shayen successfully steered his rationality to govern his mind and actions for the past few months. He understood the challenges faced by humanity on Talos-II. Northmarch Support Hub had taken on an immense mission. Space exploration must make way for more pressing matters and important projects.
But as Shayen packed and moved his personal belongings from the lab he worked at, he could not help but look at the two volumes of Ferdinandian Physics on the bookshelf. An indescribable sense of emptiness and defeat washed over him. He reviewed his life. Everything he worked for and loved became mere exhibits covered by canvas.
Shayen remembered the childhood fairytale about Dusk Beauty Flying to the Moon, the teenage science fiction novels of high adventure in outer space he read as a school kid, and the empirical laws laid down by the legendary physicist Ferdinand Clooney. He had always felt that his soul was never trapped to a single world.
For the past 40 years, Shayen spent most of his time working on Originium propulsors, heat and Blight resistant materials, processed and compressed Originium fuel, and other technological instruments and products too esoteric for the laypeople. He worked with teams who shared his vision of reaching out into space itself. Though he never saw Terra, he had faith that she existed somewhere in the infinite cosmos. To reach out for the stars was to start a journey of endless questions, results, and answers.
Shayen made an important decision that night. He ignored the regulation that required him to archive years of his research notes and results. Instead, he secreted a copy into a data disk along with the blueprints. He then contacted the director of innovations and science at Northmarch Support Hub. Many of the world's brightest minds toiled for years on these next-gen technologies. Even if the descendants of Terra no longer yearned for the stars, these discoveries and knowledge will help them explore the new world of Talos-II.
He must give meaning to everything they had done.

weaponDesc.cn:
先祖居尚蜀，好游学，一日远游，遇骤雨，避之山壁下，拾枯草燃火自暖。方将小憩，忽见一玄衣人，其人状甚异，无目无口，臂接于山。先祖异之，问曰：“先生手生岩中，所为何故？”
怪人答曰：“昔日我居百灶，一日梦黄衣小人立于掌心，问人之性命几重。答曰：‘人命重于山。’小人闻之欣然笑曰：‘吾乃掌中国之君也。’言毕遂去，自此不复见。我不忍覆其国，遂置手于地，百年不移。年久日深，掌上渐生大山，汝今所见者是也。”
先祖未解，复问曰：“先生仁厚矜怜，何不怜己，断腕以求解脱，何如？”怪人曰：“我不知‘掌中一国’孰与‘臂前一掌’重，及至通悟，或可负山而行矣。”怪人复曰：“勿忧我，自可安眠。”先祖遂寝。及晓，不复见怪人。
吾尝闻尚蜀之地有草名“枕黄”，微毒，焚之令人入幻，先祖或为之惑欤！
weaponDesc.en:
My ancestor was a well-learned man who lived at Shangshu. During one of his journeys, he encountered a sudden downpour that forced him to seek shelter beneath the cliffs. He made a warming fire with dried grass, and was about to sleep when he saw a strange individual wearing jet-black clothing. The entity had no eyes nor mouth and its arm was joined to the mountain itself. My ancestor thus asked this strange entity: "Sir, why is your arm joined with the rock?" 
The strange being replied: 
"I once lived in Baizao. One day, I dreamed of a tiny figure dressed in yellow who stood in the middle of my palm and it asked me about the weight of human life. 'It is heavier than the mountains.' I answered.
"The tiny figure smiled and replied: 'And I am the Ruler of the Kingdom in the Palm.' And with that, the tiny figure disappeared and was never seen again. I did not want to overturn its kingdom, and thus I placed my hand upon this very place and did not move it for a century. As the years passed, a great mountain gradually rose from my palm. You are looking at it right now."
My ancestor was confused and asked: "You are a kind and caring soul, but why allow yourself to be trapped here for so long? Your concerns are genuine and true, but why don't you severe your hand and be freed from this place?"
The strange being mused: "I do not know which weighs more — the Kingdom Upon the Palm, or the Palm Before My Wrist. Perhaps if I found the answer, I would be able to bear the weight of this mountain and travel with it."
The strange being then continued: "Now, leave me in peace, and you shall have yours." With that, my ancestor fell asleep. Dawn broke, but the strange being was not seen again. 

I also heard about a herb that goes by the name Zhenhuang. The grass is mildly toxic and burning it generates hallucinogenic fumes. Perhaps this ancestor of mine had breathed in a whiff too many!

weaponDesc.cn:
他想象过无数次自己再度遇见卢德森·沃克时的情景——
或许是在新蓝卡坞哪部军旅大片的片场，看他作为军事顾问接受工作人员的致敬与求教；或许是在玛尔斯波利斯的图书馆前，看他以铁誓军代表的身份与工团的年轻人们畅谈军人的生涯；或许……
可能性五花八门，无一不符合他的这位老战友作为铁誓军曾经的“明日之星”，永远冲在最前线的光辉形象。但唯独不会像此刻——
在一辆开往菈梵朵玛的客车上，看他背着一把电吉他，因为看错了发车时间，对着一张黑曜石音乐节的宣传海报唉声叹气，如同遇到了什么天大的难题。
仿佛是为了验证“一定是自己认错人了”一样，他走上前，一边朝这个和战友长得过分相似的中年人行了个标准的军礼，一边试图在对方脸上看到诸如“莫名其妙”“见了鬼”的神情。遗憾的是，这份侥幸在对方惊喜地喊出他名字的那刻彻底落空。
“小巴克？居然是你？！”
这个长得和卢德森很像的中年人……不，这显然就是卢德森本人，毕竟全塔卫二会叫他“小巴克”这绰号的一共也就不到五个人了，他想。
“我想想，我们有多少年没见了啊……”卢德森像是认真地算起了数，接着猛地叹了口气，“唉，都快二十年了吧？真快啊……”
他点点头，还没想好要怎么接话，就听卢德森满是怀念地自顾自地说了下去。
“当初我们整个旗队就你最喜欢把‘退役’的事挂在嘴上……我还和文森特他们打过赌，赌你会不会是我们旗队第一个回老家的。
“结果我输得可惨了哈哈哈，第一个回去的就是文森特那小子，他啊……”
“……为什么？”他终于忍不住插嘴，“不是说……‘我这条命只会留在战场上’吗？”
——为什么连身经百战的英雄都没能坚持到最后？
卢德森沉默，脸上的笑容在一瞬间冻结。半晌，紧捏着音乐节海报的中年人才苦笑着再度开口。
“没想到第一个问我这个的竟然是你……我提交退役申请的时候，连堡主都没说什么。
“不过，如果你是想要一个解释——那只能说……因为我发现自己开始害怕了。
“开始怕被派去侦察极光壁之后的禁地，开始怕继续面对那些根本杀不完还越来越难打的怪物……
“我感觉得到……那种被叫作‘勇气’的东西在慢慢从我身体里溜走，我找不到任何留住它的办法，总有一天我恐怕连挽留它的那点气力都会没了吧。
“既然留不住，那至少也该给彼此一个体面点的‘告别’？所以我选择了退役……而不是哪天一觉醒来，发现自己正躲在某个洞穴里瑟瑟发抖，只因为遭遇了打不赢的天使就当了逃兵。”

“……那现在呢？你背上这把电吉他又是怎么回事？”

于是，46岁的卢德森·沃克露出了20年前最常挂在脸上的灿烂笑容。
“它吗？它是我用得最顺手的一把好武器。
“虽然偶尔会出那么点岔子，不过和我在乐队的战友们配合得不错……
“也是因为他们和它，才让我在当个没什么名气的三流重金属乐手的间隙，还能在脑子里想着该用电吉他的哪根弦勒断天使的头。”
weaponDesc.en:
He had imagined his reunion with Ludson Walker countless times —
Maybe Mr. Walker could be hired as a military consultant for some New Wrankwood war movie and receive both respect and questions from the movie crew. Maybe Mr. Walker could appear before the library of Morospolis as a representative of the Order of Steel Oath and talk about an Oathkeeper's life with young UW crew mates. Maybe...
There were countless possibilities, all of them fitting for his fellow Oathkeeper, the "rising star" of the Order, and the glorious soldier who always fought at the very front. But the actual reunion was the complete opposite —
He saw the man who resembled Ludson on a coach to La Fantoma. "Ludson" carried an electric guitar on his back. He sighed at a poster for the Obsidian Festival as though he encountered a major problem. Perhaps he misread the coach schedules.
To ensure he only "mistook another person for an old comrade", he approached the middle-aged man and performed a standard salute, hoping to get or see "what the hell" or "friggin' nutcase" from the man. Unfortunately, his hopes were dashed when the man's face transformed to be a joyous surprise and shouted out his name.
"Bucky?! Is that you?!"
The middle-aged man who resembled Ludson ... happened to be Ludson himself. He counted the number of people throughout Talos-II who would call him "Bucky". That number was no more than five.
"Geesh, how many years have passed since we last met...?" Ludson looked seriously engaged in the counting and sighed heavily when he arrived at the figures, "Ugh. Close to twenty years! Time really does fly..."
Bucky nodded and before he could think of a proper response, Ludson continued his nostalgia.
"You're the one in our banner who always talked about getting a discharge... I even made a bet with Vincent and friends if you'd be the first to pack and scamper home.
"And I lost the entire thing! Vincent, that sorry sod, was the first to quit. He..."
"Wha...? WHY?" Bucky could not help but interrupt, "What happened to the saying, 'I'd only leave my life upon the fields of war'...?"
— Even the most experienced hero and veteran did not make it to the last.
Ludson became silent, his smile suddenly froze on his face. The middle-aged man who gripped the music festival poster in his hands only continued to speak after a pause.
"I never thought you'd be the first to ask me that question... Even the Castellan stayed silent when I submitted my discharge papers.
"But if you really want an explanation — I just gotta say... I found myself started getting the frights.
"I started to fear recon missions in the exclusion zones beyond the Aurora. The endless horde of buggers that grew tougher by the day began to scare me... I don't want to face them anymore...
"I felt it... I felt the virtue of 'courage' slipping away from my body and I couldn't find anyways to keep it within me. There will come a day when I grow too weak to even hold on to it.
"And since I couldn't hold on to my guts and balls, I might as well say my goodbyes in an honorable fashion. Voluntary discharge was my way... I don't want to wake up shaking like a spineless deserter pissing myself in a cave after running away from a rock bugger I can't beat."

"...But what's this? Why are you carrying an electric guitar?"

With that question, 46-year old Ludson Walker gave his signature smile of radiance that he always wore 20 years ago.
"This? Oh, it's a wonderful weapon that I found myself pretty good at.
"It still sputters occasionally, but it works for me and my comrades...
"My toy and my band mates are pretty accommodating. When I'm not a guitarist for a third-rate heavy metal band you've never heard of, I can still think about which of these guitar strings I can use to strangle a buggerloid and twist its blighted head off."

weaponDesc.cn: 我咨询过余烬干员了，她同意参加佩科5的性能验证测试。尽管是萨科塔，但我一次也没有见过余烬干员在战斗中使用铳械，我还以为她会回绝我的提议，真是走运。余烬干员还告诉我，铁誓军在北方有自己的铳械生产线，而佩科5与熔炉要塞生产的制式装备相比“看起来还不差”。也许是我想多了，但我真心希望她不是在照顾合作方的心情，如果能得到一些严厉、直接的批评意见，我反而会安心许多。
weaponDesc.en:
I've asked Operator Ember and she agreed to take part in the Peco 5 performance trials. Ember might be a Sankta, but I'd never seen her fight with guns before. In fact, I thought she would turn me down outright. Guess I got lucky.

Ember also told me how the Order of Steel Oath operate their own firearms manufactories in the north. She also said that Peco 5 was "comparable" to the standard issues produced by Fort Forgefane. I might be overthinking things, but I truly wished she would set aside her diplomatic niceties of being an Endfield partner. I would feel safer if she gave us an honest review or even outright criticisms.

weaponDesc.cn:
《关于天使成为低损耗工具的可能性》

关于前一份邮件，我错误地将天使视作“潜在用户”，并遭到了您的批评一事，我已经深刻反省。不过，我的想法仍旧没有改变——天使不应只是敌人。我们应该继续此类研究。
首先，我们没有研究证据表明，所有天使都在锚点，以及锚点背后的、北方的大敌的控制之下。有相当部分的天使虽然展现了破坏性，但却毫无逻辑和目的性可言，因此可归类为一种自然现象。而尝试模仿动物（我知道它们不是！）并发明出一些便利社会的玩意，则是我们的天性。
前一个百年，也是我们尝试在塔卫二站稳脚跟的百年，我们已经取得了许多成绩。而关于天使的研究，唯一引起轩然大波的，只有“天使”这个称呼引发了部分萨科塔同胞们的不满。这实在是太暴殄天物了。所以，请您务必承认我的研究方向，并给予一定量的资金支持。
言归正传。我的团队（就是我的儿子）成功在荒野捕获了一只小型天使。它呈现出小爪兽的样貌，比源石虫可能还小一些。您以为我要尝试驯服它？当然不是。我知道这条路行不通，不然一百多年早就有人成功了。我只是在寻找它身上可利用的部分。
天使的结构，部分与部分之间，存在某种力场、磁场一类的东西。它们的四肢（有时候是八肢）不完全依赖物理上的连接，这大家都知道，对不对？我们在野外都会见到这类天使的“激活”行为。
那么这其中的原理是否能为我们所用呢？比如，我们把天使的两个部分固定在两只机械臂上，它是否就会源源不断地产生动能？
以此为基础，我在家完成了一个天才的发明：天使自动核桃夹子！只要把天使一个小部分固定在浇筑好的金属底座上，放上核桃，天使“合并”的时候就可以砸碎核桃。
根据天使的具体形状，我相信这一发明可以衍生出无数种形态。
详细的图纸和说明随邮件奉上。期待您的回复。
weaponDesc.en:
Regarding the Feasibility of Using Aggeloi as Cost-Effective Tools

I have fully reflected upon my last letter where I proposed to treat the Aggeloi as "potential clients", to which you correctly criticized as an act of misguided error on my part. However, my core philosophy has remained the same. We should not treat the Aggeloi purely as an enemy, and our studies on their other potential roles and/or uses should continue.
Firstly, there is no evidence suggesting that all Aggeloi are under the control of Ankhors or the great nemesis in the north. A significant number of Aggeloi may have exhibited destructive behaviors, but their actions were not governed by any logic and we failed to discern any higher objectives thereof. Thus, the Aggeloid modus operandi can be safely considered as part of their natural instincts. And our own natural instinct is to take inspirations from various creatures (and I know Aggeloi aren't beasts!) and invent things that benefit human civilization.
Much has been achieved throughout the last century, the same century during which we strove to build a strong foundation upon Talos-II. However, we hardly made any progress in our understanding of the Aggeloi. The only thing we elicited was displeasure from the Sankta who felt extremely offended by how we decided to name these creatures. Our lack of knowledge about the Aggeloi is a travesty. I beg you to acknowledge the importance of my pursuit and offer a grant large enough to continue my research.
That being said, my team (which comprises my son) successfully captured a small Aggelos specimen in the wildlands. It was slightly smaller than an Originium Slug and resembled a clawbeast pup. Perhaps you think I would attempt to domesticate it, but that was not my intent. If that were possible, someone would have done it during the last hundred years. My objective was to identify parts of the creature that could be of use to us.
Instead of physical or mechanical connections, the academic consensus believes that there exists some form of an energy or magnetic field between the Aggeloid tagmata and the "joints" of their 4 (and sometimes 8) segmented appendages. Field researchers had already provided witness reports of the Aggeloi "activating" these fields.
Perhaps the working principles of this Aggeloid articular spatial field can be used in actual applications. Attaching Aggeloid components to 2 articulating parts of a robotic servo arm may provide the machinery with a ready and endless source of power.
With that in mind, I came up with an ingenious invention at my own residence — Aggeloid Auto-Nutcracker! I fashioned this particular device by attaching small, excised parts of an Aggelos onto a makeshift ram and base made from cast metal. Placing a walnut on the base and "contracting" the Aggeloid articular spatial field generated sufficient force to crush the walnut.
I believe similar setups can be applied to other applications, so long as we find Aggeloid components of the right size and shape.
Attached are detailed blueprints and instructions of the Aggeloid Auto-Nutcracker. I certainly hope to hear from you soon.

weaponDesc.cn:
我想我需要申请退休。
这颗星球，空空如也。
十年，近三十次大型挖掘，我都发现过什么？乌萨斯人失落在巨大裂谷中的战争兵器？还是因天使狂潮而不得不废弃，又因侵蚀而异常现象频发的自动化牧场？
这些只是打开破木箱，翻出些陈年烂账罢了。
真正的历史，独属于这颗星球的，属于人类起源的遗迹——我所掘出的三处，无不是空空如也。没有尸骸，没有能源，没有设备，只留些许金属。冰冷的金属泛着些光，我透过光，看到的是大河源头人类先祖们朦胧的身影，他们笑得开心。
我们的发现并未跨越我们自身，我们的过去与未来仍旧笼罩在迷雾中。塔卫二幽隐于帷幕之后，不愿显露自我。一位众生长地的游人告诉我，他们最初的师者曾在万里冻土中窥见这颗星球的一道影子，它一闪而逝，却在那位师者心中留下了比塔罗斯还要庞大的恐惧。我将这件事讲给了一位铁誓军朋友，她说，当她站在城墙上，眺望着北方天空中浓重凝实的阴云时，她觉得星球的影子就在阴云之后，而当她向前迈步，站到战场上，她就会觉得遥远的暗影向后退去了些许。
“别想太多，坚持。”
这是她将手中铳械赠予我时说的。
好吧，好吧，我要再次出发了。
weaponDesc.en:
I think I need to retire.
There is nothing to be had on this world.
Did we make any great findings after 10 years and nearly 30 major excavation attempts? No. We found only engines of war that the Ursine were forced to abandon in the Great Rift Valley and the ruins of automated pastures given up to the hosts of Aggeloi and the never-ending Blight.
These discoveries were little more than rotting crates of our mundane past.
The true history of Talos-II would be the ruins left behind by our ancestors — And I unearthed 3 of these sites. All were empty. We found no bodies, no sources of power, and no machineries. There was nothing. Nothing but shards of metal. They did give off a light that I could peer into. I saw fuzzy images of our ancestors who lived eons ago. I saw them smile. The smiles looked genuine. Our ancestors looked happy.
None of our discoveries revealed what happened before us. In fact, our very own past remains shrouded. Talos-II continues to hide behind the obscuring veil. A Songseeker of the Hannabit Circuit told me their very first Aldertone caught a glimpse of the world's shadowy past in the frozen icefields. This tiny glimpse scarred her with a monumental terror greater than Talos itself.
I told this to an Oathkeeper friend of mine. She replied with her own tale. Whenever she stood atop the Order fortress walls and gazed into the thick dark clouds that smothered the northern skies, she could feel the planet's shadow lurking behind it. This shadow would briefly retreat whenever she stepped onto the battlefield.
"Be strong, and do not think too much about it."
Those were her words when she gave me her handcannons.   Fine. I'm putting off the retirement. I'm heading out there again.

weaponDesc.cn:
“所以我们算是困在这里了，我和你，一个雷神工业冉冉升起的新星流水线工人，和一个经验老到，面容坚毅的工团……呃……老哥你是做什么的？”
“武器，我给铳械加装最后的源石保险机构。”
“好，那就是一个高手武器匠。总之我们被困在这儿了，被一场侵蚀带来的道路阻断困着，等咱们脱困，我要把这段故事讲给所有工友听……哎，你这绷带绑得可真是好，要是我一个人在这儿，可没办法处理自己的手指骨折问题。”
“你驻扎在荒野，不学一些急救知识？”
“初来乍到没有经验嘛，哈哈，我本以为我不会出外勤，但谁让人手紧张，跟车这种工作也被我抽中了呢。我和你说，离家之前我攒了半年的工资，一大卷钞票，这么大一卷，我用它买了三年的综合保险以及近文明环带区域应急救援保险，结果，哎呀，屁用没有……嗯？你怎么看起来很茫然？”
“抱歉，想到了一些小事，我在想我好像很久没有摸过纸钞了。”
“对对对对对！没错！听说工团没有工资和钱的概念，你们固定每周会发生活物资是吧，真的假的？”
“钱，工资，这些都会有，只是……不太用得到。我们大部分生产基地都地处偏僻，拿这次任务说吧，对你来说，属于来到了荒野，对我来说，则算是向后，向安全区退了一些……每个基地配发物资都算齐全，钱……很多时候的确用不到。”
“听着有点……呃……枯燥，那你要不来雷神工业？对呀！我怎么把这件事忘了，我们最近引荐新人有奖励……你扔了个什么东西过来？工牌？雷神工业？开玩笑，咱们这不是同事吗？”
“是旧工牌，芯片取走了，留着外壳做纪念，几年前我在雷神。”
“那你为什么……”
“因为这么多年我一直不太能习惯技术革新与商业化的直接挂钩，当然，雷神是家好公司，离开那里是因为我的奇怪洁癖。另外，总要有人抱成一团向外走，去开辟险地，你说对不对？”
“道理是这样的道理，可……咦？什么东西在滴滴作响……”
“通信器，我的工友定位到了我的信标异常，正在赶来救援，我们要向边界位置靠拢一些。”
“不愧是高手！哎，你真不考虑回雷神工业吗？重新入职说不定……”
“走了走了。”
weaponDesc.en:
"I guess we're both trapped here. You and me. Now, we got a RAYTHEAN floor worker of their brand new production line and a stoic and well-grizzled UWST ... ughh ... What exactly is your job, bro?"
"Weapons. I install Originium primer safety mechanism on our guns."
"Grreeeat. That means we got an expert weaponsmith. Too bad the Blight blocked the roads and got us both trapped here. I'm gonna tell every Raytheanite about this once we get our sorry butts out of here... By the way, you're really good with bandages. I would never be able to fix my fractured finger if I were here alone."
"You should have picked up some first-aid knowledge. This is the wildlands, mate."
"It's my first time working out here. Frontier-fresh, you know. Heh. Never expected them to assign me to a field job but I guess they never got enough Raytheanites to work out here. We drew lots, and yeah, got myself the short end of the stick and ended up with the convoy escort job. Hey, I might not look like it, but I stashed away six months' worth of pay before leaving home. Bought myself three years' worth of general insurance and emergency first-aid coverage plans for the Band Periphery with a wad of cash this thick! LOOK! THIS THICK! And KABAM! Actual accident happens and none of them works! Wasted all my cold hard cash on this blightery... Hey. Why do you look so lost and confused?"
"Sorry... I ... just remembered a few things. I haven't seen printed creds for a while." 
"Oooh! That's right! I just remembered! The U-double-U don't use no cold hards. They pay you in ... what? Weekly ration tickets? Is that true?"
"We actually do get paychecks. In T-creds. But our sites tend to be in ... less populated regions of the frontier so we got nowhere to spend 'em. You might treat this job as a frontiers run, but it's more like a southward trip towards the safe zone for me. Our bases are also better stocked in these parts, so ... I guess I didn't really have to spend any money either way..."
"That sounds ... hmm ... boring ... I guess. Oh! Dang it! Nearly forgot about this! We get fat bonuses if we get good people into RAYTHEAN! So, interested in becoming a Raytheanite...? Wow. What did you just throw at me? Wait. This is a RAYTHEAN Pass... You gotta be joking. You're an ex-Raytheanite?"
"Yeah. Ex-Ray. They dechipped my pass when I left several years ago. I got to keep this as a souvenir."
"So why did you..."
"Because 'Innovation Makes Future' became Innovation Makes the Big Bucks. I just can't stand seeing new tech being used solely for profit. Look ... RAYTHEAN is a good company, make no mistake about that... Maybe it's just me who's weird... Anyways, we need to stick together to survive the frontiers. Things would be better if there were more Raytheanites out here, right?"
"You have a point, but... Wait. I'm hearing a ringing noise..."
"It's my comm device. My fellow crew mates must have noticed something wrong with my positioning signals. An SAR team should be on their way. We should try to get closer to the area's border."
"Wow. You're a true survivalist! So, uhm... You're really ... not thinking about rejoining RAYTHEAN? They may have bonuses for returning Ex-Rays... Being a Re-Ray might be..."
"Get moving already. Sheesh."

weaponDesc.cn:
想听听信使法尔肯·格拉夫宁的故事吗？
在泰拉，他的名字几乎无人记得。人们记住的是他所背负的身份：天灾信使。
法尔肯·格拉夫宁出身于卡西米尔边境，年轻时便踏上了那条孤独的道路。他迈着坚定的脚步，跋山涉水，将天灾的消息带到一个又一个濒临毁灭的城镇。当然，他不是拯救者，他所能做的，只是让人们知道“灾祸的脚步近了”。有人感激他，也有人怨恨他。他受过伤，目睹过牺牲，恶语与冷眼更是伴随多年，抑郁的阴霾长久笼罩在他的心头。
直到五十三岁那年，他决定告别故土的一切，将生命的最后时光交付给那颗新发现的星球——塔卫二。
在这里，他不再是“灾厄的预兆”，只是一个普通的信使。塔卫二辽阔、宁静，至少在那段短暂的岁月里，它没有天灾，没有覆灭的阴影。法尔肯心生出一种久违的安宁。他背着行囊，穿梭在开拓基地之间，寄送信件、护送物品、传递情报。
空闲时，他独自远行。他甚至借助源石设备拼装过简陋的飞行器，摇摇欲坠地划过天空，降落在从未有人涉足的荒野；他攀登高山，穿过沼泽，将自己的脚印留在空白之地。
面对这片未经天灾蹂躏的土地，他开始憧憬——退休之后，要在哪个山谷建造木屋；盛夏时在哪处高原避暑，呼吸清冽的空气。他的笔记本上，密密麻麻记下了路线、地形与憧憬中的“理想乡”。随着他的足迹所至，地图上越来越多的空白被填补。
直到那一天到来。
锚点坠落，天使降临，人们又像躲避天灾一样逃命。
混乱中，法尔肯再一次背负起了旧日的职责。他成为最可靠的向导，带领幸存者向南逃亡。人们说，他曾无数次挺身而出，为大家探明前进的道路，甚至独自驾着破旧的飞行器冲进风暴，拖着遍体鳞伤的身体返回。他用经验、毅力与勇气，替难民们打开一条条生路。许多定居点的建立，正是靠他留下的标记或口述的引导。若没有他，或许很多人根本走不到环带。
但他没有停下。
在生命的最后几年，法尔肯依旧不断向南。他跨过群山，踏遍环带，最终来到了大海的边缘。传说中，他在那里造了一条船，扬帆启航，向更南的彼方驶去。
自那之后，人们再也没有见过他。
在塔卫二的航海者之间，流传着一种说法：在海天交界处，如果看见一片特殊形状的云，仿佛一面高举的船帆，那就是“法尔肯的船帆”，预示着好天气的到来。
后世尊称他为“领航者”。在每一座城市、学府、港口，总会有人讲述法尔肯的故事：他是信使，是探路者，是孤独的旅人，是在黑暗中高举灯火的人。
梅什科工业以此为概念，将领航者的精神铸入本年度的系列新品，献给每一个对无垠的未来充满野心和勇气的人。

“又是广告软文，要给我看的就这些吗？”
“当然不止。我要介绍的，是篇新发表的论文，关于法尔肯·格拉夫宁不为人知的秘密。”
“哦？”
“法尔肯·格拉夫宁之所以不断向南，是因为他相信，或许在遥远的南极，还有另一座尚未被发现的星门。”
“另一个……星门？这真的可能吗？”
“谁知道呢，没有人能证实，也没有人能否认。或许，他真的在海的尽头找到了回家的路；或许，他从此消失在了浪涛之中。”
“所以……”
“所以，在人生的最后，支撑着‘领航者’的，不只是探索和冒险的热情，而是一种更深切的渴望——回家。”
weaponDesc.en:
Interested in the story of the messenger named Falken Gravning?
Hardly any Terran remembered his name. What they did remember was his job — a Catastrophe Messenger.
Falken was born in the borders of Kazimierz and started this lonesome career when he was but a young man. With sturdy steps he hiked across mountains and navigated rivers to bring verified data of Catastrophe signs to villages, towns, and cities facing inevitable destruction. He was not a savior. The only thing he could do was to warn people of the "impending footsteps of annihilation". Some were grateful, while others bore grudges. He suffered more than a few wounds, vile curses, as well as cold, hateful gaze over the years, and witnessed grave sacrifices as well. Suffocating depression constantly loomed over his soul.
When he turned 53, he decided to leave his homeland behind and devote the final years of his life to the newly discovered planet — Talos-II.
Here in the new world, he was no longer a "prophet of doom" but a mere common messenger. For those few short years, the serene, open expanses of Talos-II was free from Catastrophes and the ever-present threat of destruction. A sense of long-absent peace filled Falken. He took his backpack and roamed the lands between the pioneering bases, delivering letters, escorting supplies, and conveying intel with every trip.
When he had time for himself, he continued to travel alone. He even cobbled together several Originium devices to create a rudimentary aircraft. Though it flew awkwardly across the skies, he could land it upon unexplored wilderness. He climbed majestic peaks, waded through dark swamps, and left his footprints in this untouched realm.
He started to picture a beautiful future for the land untouched by Catastrophes — Once he retires, he would build a wooden cabin in some valley. He would also have a mountaintop summer retreat where he could enjoy clean, refreshing air. His notebook was filled with trails, routes, contour maps, and ideas for his "ideal home". As he spread footprints across the world, more and more of the blank areas were filled.
Until that very day.
The day when the Ankhors fell from the skies and the Aggeloi descended upon Civilization. People were once again forced to flee as they had done with Catastrophes struck.
During the era of chaos, Falken once again took up his old profession. He became the most reliable guide and led the survivors in a desperate southbound trek of survival. People said he stepped up to the challenge in numerous occasions to mark out the road forward. He even flew that ramshackle aircraft of his into the storm, and returned with a beaten and badly wounded body. With experience, grit, and courage, he paved multiple trails of life for the refugees. Numerous outposts, villages, and towns were founded thanks to his way markers or verbal directions. Without Falken as their guide, many would fail to reach the Civilization Band alive.
But that was not the end of Falken's journey.
During the last years of his life, Falken continued to journey south. He traversed the mountain ranges and roamed the entire Band until he finally arrived at the edge of the great ocean. Legend then claimed that Falken built a ship at that very place and sailed off to find a place even further south.
And Falken was never seen again after that.
A particular story was rather popular amongst the oceanic navigators of Talos-II: Should one see a cloud, shaped like a raised mast with full sails at the place where the oceans and heavens meet, that would be "Falken's Sail", and that would be tidings for good weather.
People call him the "Navigator". Falken's story was told in every city, school, and port. He was a messenger, a pathfinder, a lonely traveler, and the one who raised the beacon high during humanity's hour of darkness.
Mieszko Industries is proud to uphold this concept. Our latest series for this year have been imbued with the spirit of the Navigator. We dedicate it to every ambitious and courageous individual eager to face the boundless future.

"This is just a promotional tale. Is this all I'm going to read?"
"Of course not. I'm about to introduce this latest paper on the untold secrets of Falken Gravning."
"Oh?"
"Falken Gravning kept going south because of his belief that another undiscovered Cosmic Gate may exist in the south pole of this world."
"Another ... Cosmic Gate? Is that even possible?"
"Who knows? Nobody could prove nor disprove it. Who knows? He might have found a way home at the end of the sea, or simply disappeared beneath the waves."
"So..."
"So towards the end of his life, what kept the 'Navigator' going wasn't his passion for exploration or adventure. It was a far more deeper desire — He wanted to go home."

weaponDesc.cn:
萨科塔穿过战场，停在一位重伤倒地的工团成员身前。她俯下身，简单地查看了伤势，恐怕这名伤员已撑不到医护人员赶来。

“愿你终将寻到安宁。”

萨科塔抓住他的双手，祈祷这可怜的人能够得到安息。
他是第几个？第三十个？还是第三百个？萨科塔思索着，握着那双早已冰冷的手，直到背后传来土石的响动。她闪电般拔出了铳——那是一只天使，头顶一轮忽明忽暗的光环。
萨科塔缓步走向这只瘫倒的天使，它已不再具有威胁，大半身体已被工人卫队的炮火击碎。

萨科塔的心中存在疑问，而她知道自己不会从眼下的境况中得到答案。从寂语修会庞大的移动修道院行驶在塔卫二的那天起，在萨科塔们亲眼目击第一只天使后，他们——我们就注定无法依靠他人得到答案。

“律法恩典，引我踏上归途……”

每一位寂语修会的萨科塔都会唱这首圣歌。萨科塔沐浴在圣徒的目光中跨过星门，颂唱着同一首圣歌，奔走在散落塔卫二的残迹间。
她仍记得，伏龙达院长在晨祷时讲述过一个故事：在那史书尚未记载的时代，提卡兹寻求主的庇佑，成为了萨科塔；在主离开圣殿的时代，最初的圣徒向萨科塔展示了她提卡兹的容貌。但这个故事，却让她充满了疑惑。
如若光环是主亲手赐予萨科塔的、独一无二的礼物，那么光环下成群的、称不上拥有生命的塔卫二天使，从何而来？

又是什么塑造了你们？

萨科塔握紧了手中的铳，无人解答她的疑惑。仿佛这世界只有手中的铳能被称作真实。
很快，最后一根锚点消失在地平线上，前线传来了宣告胜利的汽笛声。联盟工团再次完成了他们的开拓使命，从此刻起，文明环带将在另一片荒芜之地上站稳脚跟。
在欢呼声中，她将双手放在了这“濒死”的天使头上。她似乎能从这本应没有任何情绪的异物上感到一股细微的波动……最终归为一片全然空无的宁静。
主为萨科塔赐予了光环，但这份恩赐似乎并不独属于萨科塔。她思索着这一切背后可能的意义，直至信仰再度充盈她的心房。此时此刻，在此处，来自寂语修会的萨科塔有另一场临终祷告要做。

“无论来自何处，愿你终将寻到安宁。”

碎石崩落，尘土溢出萨科塔的指缝。那隐隐显现的光环，终于消散在空气中。
weaponDesc.en:
The Sankta navigated through the battlefield and stopped by a severely injured UWST crew mate. She stooped over and made a cursory check of the wounds. The crew mate was unlikely to survive until the arrival of a qualified medic.

"May you finally find eternal rest. Aeternam habeas requiem."

The Sankta held his hands and prayed that the poor soul may find peace.
How many like him had she found? Thirty? Or three hundred? The Sankta tried to remember as she held the hands that were already growing cold. She felt the rocks and dirt move behind her and drew her handcannon at once — An Aggelos, with a flickering halo above its head.
The Sankta slowly approached the paralyzed Aggelos. It was no longer a threat. Half of its body was already pulverized by the artillery of the Worker's Guard.

She had a question that she knew could not be explained by the things she saw in this place. Ever since the Cabal of Tranquility activated its Nomadic Monastery upon Talos-II, and ever since the Sankta witnessed the first Aggelos, they — we were destined to seek the answers on our own, for none could ever respond to that question.

"By the graces of the Law, lead me to the journey home..."

Every Sankta of the Cabal knew how to sing this anthem. They sang the song as they bathed in the gazes of the saints and crossed the Cosmic Gate. They sang the same song when they traversed the ruins scattered across the world of Talos-II.
She still remembered the story that Abbess Vronta said during morning prayer: During ancient times that predate the oldest annals, the Teekaz who sought the Lord's protection became the Sankta. And during the time when the Lord left the Temple, the First Saint revealed her Teekaz form to the Sankta. But this story only filled her with confusion.
If the halo was the Lord's exclusive gift to the Sankta and only the Sankta, then what about the hosts of lifeless yet animate constructs called the Aggeloi of Talos-II? Where did their halos come from?

Or rather, who was the one that made you?

Sankta gripped her gun tightly. No one could answer her question. The only thing that felt real was the weapon in her hand.
Soon, the final Ankhor disappeared from the horizon. The steam whistle of victory echoed throughout the battle lines. Once again the UWST pioneers pushed deeper into the frontier. This was the moment when the Civilization Band finds another secure footing in the desolate lands.
While those around her cheered, the Sankta placed both her hands on the head of the "dying" Aggelos. She thought she had felt something pulse within the supposedly unfeeling abomination ... but the feeling quickly gave way to empty silence.
The Lord may have blessed the Sankta with their halos, but this blessing may have been granted to others. She kept thinking about what this might mean until faith once again filled her heart. It was at this moment, and at this very place, that the Sankta from the Cabal must perform another mass for the departed.

"No matter where you are from, may you finally find eternal rest. Aeternam habeas requiem."

The rocks cracked and disintegrated as dust leaked out through the gaps between the Sankta's fingers. The flickering halo finally dissipated into the air.

weaponDesc.cn:
“我们是敲入塔卫二的楔子。”我母亲常这么说。
小时候，我总抱怨她回家拥抱我时不脱下那身厚重的工服。那感觉不像在拥抱她，而是在拥抱一堆钢铁。她抱得那么紧，坚硬的工具随着拥抱的压力在我身上留下深深的印记，久久不能消去。
我还会抱怨她给我挑选的玩具太丑。我不喜欢钻机和卡车的模型，因为我每天都能见到它们。从家里，我看着它们轰鸣着启程，连绵不断地向北方而去。日复一日，年复一年。
此外，她不愿称这里为“家”。她总是念叨：“塔卫二是颗危险的星球，这里不是家园。”
在塔卫二出生长大的我无法理解她的念叨，但这些话语如同那些坚硬的拥抱，在我身上留下了印记。只是当时的我并不知道这些“印记”意味着什么。
直到有一天，她没有从北方回来。沃尔特舅舅把她的工服带给了我，领口沾着暗红的血迹。我抱着它，感受着熟悉的粗糙、坚硬和冰冷。然后我在工服里找到了这把铳——这把无数次在我身上留下深深压痕的铳。铳管下有一处缺口。
她打光最后一颗子弹后，用铳管砸翻了一个天使。
我让沃尔特舅舅给我重铸了铳管，在上面加了个链式切割器。当北进的车流再次轰鸣时，我接替了她的位置。

我是一颗敲入塔卫二的楔子。
weaponDesc.en:
"We're the wedge that was hammered into Talos-II." Mama always said those words.
When I was a kid, Mama always gave me a strong, tight hug after coming back from her shift. I kept telling her to change out of her crew outfit first. I felt I wasn't getting hugged by mom. I was getting crushed by a hardware store and always ended up with a mess of sore, reddish imprints of hammers, pliers, wrenches, and even a big blasted handcannon on me.
And then she bought me those friggin' buggly toys, you know. I've been seeing actual cranes, drill crawlers, dumpster trucks, crushers, and pile drivers in real life. I saw entire fleets of steel giants heading north every friggin' day and every friggin' year of my childhood. I did not want mini and fake versions of them in my toybox.
And mama never treated this world as "home". She never stopped saying: "Talos-II is just too dangerous. We'll never make this our place."
I'm a Talosian, born and raised, and could never really understand why she never stopped complaining. Yet those words left an imprint on me, like those hardware tools she carried when she gave me those powerful, crushing hugs. I never knew what "imprints" meant back then.
Then came a day when mama failed to come back from the north. Uncle Walther gave me her outfit. Them laundry crew didn't wash it right and it still had this dark bloodstain on the collar. I held it tight to feel the familiar coarseness of the fabrics and the cold, hardness of her tools. And then I found that blasted handcannon — the big iron responsible for all those painful imprints I suffered. The thing sported a new dent beneath the barrel.
She emptied the magazine and then slapped an Aggelos real good with that big slab of iron.
I asked Uncle Walther to cast me a new barrel and furnish it with a chain cutter. I also got mama's position when another convoy roared for the north.

'Cause I'm the hardest wedge to be hammered into Talos-II.

weaponDesc.cn:
“因此我诅咒你们，你们的血液将在荒芜的大地之上流淌，汇聚成池，你们的族人，你们的所爱，将于血池中溺毙。”
古旧笔记上写着这样的话，于是他想了想，拿出了自己的信纸，开始书写——
“很少有人清楚裂地者为什么要追杀裂地者，毕竟他们曾是一个还算团结的整体，曾受同一个首领指挥……就算他们后续分裂了，也很难产生如此激烈的矛盾……这本笔记中记录的刻骨仇恨，以及作者抓捕到那些零散裂地者后，对他们施展出的残酷手段……似乎只有‘恐怖’两个字能形容。”
他继续思考着，但似乎对结论很不满意，于是笔尖与纸张的摩擦声继续传出。
“我试图在这些文字中寻找到一些‘共性’，比如裂地者们是否真的犯下过什么会让人觉得‘见之必杀’的罪孽，又或者他们是否有什么持续至今的邪恶计划……无论是出于工作还是爱好，探寻这些历史中的秘辛都让我足够畅快，但很可惜，这本笔记的作者只是一个质朴的恶棍，是因一次分赃不匀产生摩擦就绞死了‘同僚’全家的杀戮狂人。”
他顿了顿笔，又以更大的力度，继续书写。
“个人仇恨毫无意义，这些文字对我推进《维护塔卫二安全法案》的计划毫无帮助，只有从规则，从文明的认知，从一切黑色、白色和灰色上将裂地者彻底抹掉，人类才能足够安全。”
似乎是纸上的文字正源源不断地为他提供力量，他的书写速度愈发快了起来。
“任何文明都存在边缘处的腐烂，这些腐烂永远存在，无法根除，但我们至少要有切除它们的态度与行动。”
他写下了最后一句话。
“我以裂地者身份存活了三十年，你必须相信我。”
weaponDesc.en:
"And thus I curse you all. Your blood shall flow across the barren lands and stagnate in pools of gore. Your people and everyone you love shall drown in the filth of your veins."
These were written on the old memo. He thought about it for a while, took out his pen and paper, and started his own scribbles —
"Hardly anyone knows why Landbreakers would want to attack their own people. They used to be a rather cohesive organization led by a single leader... Though the LBs later splintered, such levels of hostility between the successor groups seem to lack a proper basis... The seething hatred so vividly reflected by these notes as well as the brutality personally inflicted upon LBs captured by the author of the said notes can only be described as ... horrifying and gruesome..."
He paused, reflected upon his words, and felt rather displeased with his conclusions. His pen then started scrawling across the page once more.
"I attempted to identify a 'common cause' or 'consensus' in these hateful words. Perhaps the LBs committed a transgression that led to the current kill on sight mentality, or perhaps the LBs have started working on some malicious scheme that continues to this day... I have enjoyed my investigation of the secret truth behind LB history, both as my profession and as a personal pastime of mine. Unfortunately, the author of these notes was just a simple, homicidal brute. He hanged the entire family of his 'breaker-pal' over some petty division of loot."
He paused again briefly, and then continued his scrawls with greater focus and intensity.
"Personal hatred means little. These words provide nothing to my goal of advancing the Security Act for Peace on Talos-II. We must make the very concept of Landbreaking criminal in every law and an anathema to our definitions for civilization. Their presence must be removed from every community, organization, and faction, legal or otherwise. Landbreaking must end to make humanity safe again."
These words seem to lend him strength. His writings picked up speed and alacrity.
"Peripheral rot is a condition that plagues every civilization. This cancer is always there and can never be truly cleansed. However, we must demonstrate our firm resolve and initiate the strong measures to completely sterilize this malignant presence."
He then concluded his own writings with one final line.
"I spent thirty years of my life as a Landbreaker. You must have faith in my words."

weaponDesc.cn:
对塔卫二当今“前卫”艺术的挑战书

致自诩“前卫”的大艺术家们：
你们好吗？我指的是那些在废墟墙上喷涂图案，在菈梵朵玛的地下酒吧里嘶吼，自认为创造“史无前例”艺术的各位。
告诉你们一个残酷事实，你们所谓的前卫艺术，九成都是从泰拉历史中翻出的陈年旧货。
菈梵朵玛的新说唱厂牌？在看完汐斯塔黑曜石音乐节的十大经典音乐现场后，我并不觉得他们比起那位名为“大帝”的说唱巨星在律动和韵脚上有任何的创新。[链接已失效] 
艾什柏环岛的百人涂鸦？根据我挖到的资料，这些东西在泰拉曾经的乌萨斯工厂基地早就烂大街了。许多年前，感染者工人就在厂房墙上画着同样的东西。[附件已丢失]
至于新蓝卡坞的新青年电影节？那就更搞笑了，因为他们连自由市的名字都沿用的泰拉上的蓝卡坞！
真正属于塔卫二的前卫艺术在哪儿？
既然渴望创新，我告诉你们什么才是真前卫。
这是我挖到的关于终末地协议源石技术的一段视频。[作者已将此视频设为付费观看]
可能很多人会对我提到协议源石技术感到困惑，但想想看，艺术离不开工艺技术，我们如果一直在源自泰拉的技术基础上进行审美文化的再创作，就像我先前举的那些例子那样，那么我们当然就难以摆脱泰拉文化的标签！
而协议源石技术，可以说是塔卫二独有的最“前卫”、最“酷”的技术了，不是么？它彻底打破了我们对空间维度的认知，怎么我还没看到将它应用于艺术创作的艺术家？
前卫艺术不是翻新旧货，不是给古董贴新标签。
如果你们继续玩祖父辈的把戏，请不要再自诩“前卫”。

weaponDesc.en:
A formal challenge to all modern "avant garde" artists of Talos-II

To those who call themselves the great masters of the "avant garde":
How are you doing? I'm specifically talking to those who spraypaint shapes on the walls of ruins, the howlers of underground dive bars in La Fantoma, and anyone who fantasized about having a hand in creating "unprecedented" works of art.
I gotta tell you a brutal truth. At least 90% of your so-called "avant garde" art are actually dug out from the ancient heaps known as Terran history.
La Fantoma got a new rapper brand? After viewing ten live recordings from the most classic Obsidian Festivals at Siesta, these so-called neo-rappers got NOTHING on the giant known to us as "Emperor"! They made ZERO innovations on the beats, rhyme, and rhythm. [LINK NO LONGER VALID] 
Hundred-Strong Graffiti of the Asphalt Roundabout? From what I unearthed, these giant graffiti were past-tense in the Ursus factories of Terra. The Infected crew were already creating mega-graffiti at their barracks and production floors. [ATTACHMENT NOT FOUND]
Neo-Youth Film Festival of New Wrankwood? Hah. That's an even bigger joke. The Talosian free city can't even come up with their own name and just took something from the Terran city of Wrankwood.
So where the hell can we find true avant garde art of Talos-II?
If you want novelty and innovation, I'll tell you what it means to be truly avant garde.
I've unearthed a video about the Endfield Protocol-Originium Technology (Protorig Tech). [Author has set the video to pay per view]
Many might be confused about the Protorig Tech I mentioned. But you know that art cannot be fully detached from industrial tech. Derivative works of aesthetics based on Terran technology will end up like those sorry examples I listed above. We will never free ourselves from the label of Terran culture!
But Protorig Tech is the most "avant garde" and "coolest" innovation that happens to be Talos-exclusive, isn't it? It completely shattered our understanding of spatial dimensions, but why haven't I seen any artist using them as a fount for artistic creation?
Avant garde isn't about going through your trash or pasting new labels on old antiques.
So if you're fumbling around with stuff that your grandparents had fun with, STAAHHHP calling yourself "avant garde".
